I stumbled upon this place while stopping at the dollar tree. It was really late and I wanted a little bite to eat that wasn't too heavy. The inside was very clean and neat!

It was very quiet inside and the workers were friendly and helpful while I looked thru the menu. However, I went with a traditional sushi roll and some soup since I wasn't that hungry. I also got the tempura vegetables they were just ok.

I would love to go back to try some of the more explosive sushi rolls they looked pretty good on the menu. I will be back soon!

It's a hole in the wall and sometimes they have better cooked food than others, but I've always received the best service when I went there and I always like the amount of food I get for my money. It's something quick and no it's not too of the line best Chinese food in the world, however I've been on multiple occasions and have never had a problem.

Only one visit so far, but I was very impressed.  
I have been on the search for a quality General Tso's chicken for some time now.  Most places like this that are "casual" Chinese food (the type where when you walk in, you see pictures of the dishes above the counter) are similar in nature - low prices, good portions, but quality is all over the place, especially when it comes to chicken dishes.  This place was on point when it came to flavor of the General Tso's sauce and quality of the chicken.  I did not feel like because of the price ($9.50 for the large order which can easily be split) that the chicken used was of a lesser quality.  In fact, this was one of the few places where they used uniform sized cuts vs some big, some small.  While that might not seem all that important, whenever a restaurant uses larger cuts, I've noticed they usually are using lesser quality in order to do so.  I am definitely going back for more & will post again.

Tried this place on a whim. Everything was SALTY. Tried stuff you couldn't screw up - crab rangoon & pork fried rice. I could barely eat the pork fried rice. 
I won't be back.

Just met a friend here yesterday and the service was incredible and the sushi was delicious. I will be coming back for more. Monday and Tuesday is half off. So glad my friend told me about this restaurant it's in a shopping plaza in Parma near TJ maxx

My wife and I really enjoy eating here. The wait staff is always appropriate and friendly. The owner remembers us and kindly greets us when we go. My wife loves the salmon hibachi with the mushroom soup. I always get the sashimi regular. It's a great place for both authentic sushi as well as combo rolls. The price is great as well. It's our go to sushi place in Parma

Food is great but service is lacking. I would say the food is 5 stars including perhaps the best, or at least some of the best, General Tso's Chicken in Madison. But the service is usually disappointing and sometimes downright bad... 1 to 2 stars at most. Last time I was there I was with a group of 5; the waiter took all of our orders but then completely forgot to give one of them to the kitchen, spilled water on my friend, and haphazardly slammed all the food down on the table when it did arrive. He had no apology for forgetting my friend's order so my friend left. Then when we split the check he automatically put an 18% gratuity on each of our bills which we didn't notice until after we left.

I went here with my family on a Sunday afternoon for lunch, the waiter was rude, and everything we got was inedible. I got the pad thai, and it was terrible. The chicken was deep fried, and 90% fat. I can safely say that Giant Eagle's pad thai is eons better. My brother got the hibachi, and it was slightly better than mine, but still dismal. The vegetables were mush, and the fried rice was burned to a crisp. One star is generous for this place.

Great takeout food with plenty of room to eat in as well. 

We ordered sesame chicken (no tofu that day), Hunan beef, vegetable fried rice, some pork egg rolls, a vegetable egg roll, and some steak on a stick. 

All of the food was great and we had plenty for leftovers, which I love. The egg rolls were actually crispy when I got home!!!  (Must be magic...) The restaurant crew was very nice and speedy to get all the food out quickly. 

My nephew lives right up the street and never knew this gem was so close...

This is my all time favorite sushi place! If you want great sushi this is your place. Monday and Tuesday is half price sushi, the menu is huge. There are so many amazing rolls to choose from and for a great price. They have great lunch specials and overall the prices are awesome! I haven't found another sushi place I like as much as blue ginger.

Located in a strip mall, parking is plentiful. Nice interior with choice of table or booth. Visibly very well kept and clean. Greeted immediately by friendly hostess. Had a small salad before the main course, the dressing was fabulous. Had the Chicken with Broccoli, brown Rice and a spring Roll. All were well prepared and the taste was good.  Waitress was friendly and attentive. Lunch time special was well worth it. Definitely will be back and recommend.

I placed a delivery order but it didn't make it in time. I called the restaurant and asked about my order, and the person who picked up the phone kept saying that they are really busy on the weekend. However, the worst part is that he complained that I didn't put the correct address down. The person kept saying that I need to put down the full address including the number of the building (which I did and it shows up on my order confirmation that my address is 100% correct). Whoever picked up the phone was irritated and had a bad attitude. I am super upset about it because the food is already late and I didn't even complain about the delay but the restaurant was mad at me because of the address situation. When I finally get my food, the poor quality upsets me AGAIN. It does not look/taste like what I expected.
I will not order from this terrible restaurant again.

By far one of the best sushi places in the area .The ambiance with the amazing art is so welcoming . The food so sophisticated and entertaining. I always enjoy a trying different items on the menu and it never disappoints. Try the warm sake, it's smooth and delicious !

Going back to Blue Ginger for second time, I wanted to give their other menu items a try. We still ordered sushi as it was up to 50% off on Tuesdays, but we also ordered the XO Seafood Delight Dish and also the Hong Kong Style Pan Fried Noodle with chicken. Sushi was great as usual! The Seafood Delight Dish was a great portion and just the right flavors for $16.95. This dish came with a variety of seafood items including lobster tail, fresh scallop, jumbo prawn, sweet pea, mixed vegetable, chef's special XO sauce. 

One dish that really bugged my family and I was the Hong Kong Style Pan Fried Noodle. This "brown sauce" was used and although the noodles that barely touched this dish was okay, anything else that was soaked up in this brown sauce was unbearably salty. 75% of the dish was could not eat because of the amount of sauce the dish was swimming in. We believed the brown sauce is known as oyster sauce and normally, oyster sauce is used sparingly as most people know it is heavily concentrated. The chef must not have known how salty the sauce is because it was unbearable. If you are contemplating about ordering anything with the brown sauce in the ingredients, make sure to ask for the sauce to be on the side or added lightly. I would hate anyone else to have to bear through and pay for a dish they are unhappy with. Besides that, the other food was good, but this bad experience really made a bold opinion in my mind.

I enjoy the friendly, bantering service, but the food here is pretty sub par. I found a piece of plastic in my soup, and only received a 10 percent discount. Overall the food isn't great and would not recommend going.

First off, I have eaten here multiple times and the foos is good. However, the manager working there was incredibly rude to my sister. We made a phone order, clearly ordered two orders of teriyaki shrimp. When we arrived they had made chicken and instead of apologizing and correcting the order, she had an attitude and assumed we had made the error and not the man who misheard our order and cooked the wrong food. My sister was overly polite and even told the rude woman she would eat the chicken, but I could not since I don't eat chicken. We had to wait a long time for the food and the shrimp was delicious but the teriyaki chicken (which we didn't even order!!!) Was not good at all. My sister said it was bland, overcooked, and swimming in a flavorless sauce with thr consistency of water. My advice, make orders online otherwise you may be blamed for THEIR mistake. Will not be eating here any time soon

The food has always been a great quality. Definitely my go to for some quick take out. The staff has been very friendly every time we go and helpful as well. They have a great gift voucher system so if you have a big family and make a large order you get money off your next transaction! Definitely helpful in a pinch.
Decent but not outstanding Americanized Chinese food. The curry chicken with steamed vegetables was good, but everything else was just okay. Not much more to add.

How does this place have 4 out of 5 stars?  There must be a lot of people living in the Northfield area with messed up taste buds.  My wife and I ordered about two months ago and weren't really impressed.  It was quite so so.  We ordered from them a week ago for pick up and it was horrible.  Wife ordered the chicken and broccoli.   Her meal actually looked good but the taste was very bland.  I ordered the pineapple chicken. My meal was simply horrible.  My ENTIRE carry out container was full of sauce and there might have been six small pcs of chicken in there.  Thankfully I got to scrounge my wife's leftovers.  We will not be going back to this place.  Also, pay with credit card so they pay their taxes.

Let's look past the fact that it's not an ambient, authentic Chinese atmosphere, let's look at the value, and the flavor, and the fact that there's not much if any competition in the area...

Value is great, they offer several free items if you purchase certain dollar amounts of food. And you get a lot of food for the price you pay!

The flavor was great! I had General Tso's, my wife had Chicken Fried Rice, and my son had Sweet & Sour chicken... no complaints, we all enjoyed it, and even had leftovers!

You can eat there... but it's what I call 'Quick Service' or 'Counter Style', order at the counter, and you sit down. No one will be waiting on you... refilling your ice water every five minutes. This isn't a deal breaker. Besides, you get your food in about 10-15 minutes and it's hot, and delicious!

Competition... there honestly isn't any. The next closest place by comparison is either China Buffet in Century Square, or P.F. Changs. And I don't want buffet, and I don't want to pay an arm and a leg for some simple Chinese food. Further out it's either Silk Road, Sesame Inn, or China Town Inn... and it will take you forever to get to those places than you care to endure.

Hunan Wok - 5 Stars

Best.Chinese food. EVER. This is the only place I go for Chinese. I love the owners, they are so nice and it's so clean inside. The food is out of this world delicious and I love they always give a few extra crab rangoons because those are my favorite! This place won't let you down!

We've been looking for a new Chinese spot to go to since our old restaurant changed owners (and the quality right with it). Dragon Garden was nearby and the Yelp reviews were positive. Menu selection was expansive and very tasty. Our family of finicky eaters were quite pleased and well fed.  Will definitely go again.

I should preface this review by saying the 4 stars is assuming you seek Good "americanized chinese delivery type place". If you are looking for sweet and sour pork, good fried rice etc of that variety it is a pretty good local shop :) . 

However if you are from china or china town, or expect authentic... This aint that kikda place, not in house regional or spicy sauces for the more advanced pallet... nor spicy fish, salt/pepper squid, or the more traditional authentic menu items. Just need to differentiate that but its good for americanized :)

I've eaten here a handful of times but only in cases where my favorite place in the area is closed. Dragon Garden tends to have longer hours and works on more holidays that others in the area. The food is OK, but never great. I've never been thrilled with the quality of the meat but it is not terrible. I've only ever ordered out so I have not experienced the hibachi.

Employees are all very friendly and the place is very clean. I wouldn't say it is the best Chinese food I've ever had but it's decent. We ordered the general Tso combo plate and the chicken was kind of dry and stringy. We will definitely be back but probably will try ordering something different. It was very busy when we ordered our takeout so the wait was close to an hour, but that seemed like a good sign of good food.
As far as American Chinese food goes this is average. Four of us had combo plates and we all felt the same - adequate but not excellent.

To start off I must say Smiles is much better. Not that dragon garden was bad but smiles is better. When I walked in for my pick up order there was no one there to greet me so if I was there to dine in I would have been waiting a good ten minutes. That being said I had called my order in about 20 minutes prior and the lady on the phone said 15 minutes and it would be ready. So if you can do math that's a good 30 minutes when she claimed it to be 15. Any way back to the food. I ordered szechuan chicken like I always do from smiles and the flavor was just off, and there was some funky lingering after taste to the rice as if it had been made with dirty dish water or something. Any way I don't think I will be going back. Smiles I wish you weren't closed yesterday :(
The food quality is great.  Friendly service.  Definitely one of my fav spots to visit on a budget.  And did I say real chicken!!!! Awesome spot

Very good chinese food.  Excellent sized portions.  My wife and I both ordered the War-Su Gai and it was excellent.  (For some reason chinese restaurants in Cuyahoga Falls do not offer it) .   My daughter had the Cicken Lo-Mein and said it was the best she has ever eaten.   Generous fried rice portions as well.   The service was excellent.
This is definitely our favorite local Chinese takeout! We're always happy to drive by the three places that are closer to us to go to Dragon Garden.

We've been coming here since 1999. We moved to Phoenix in 2003 and can't wait to eat here when we come back to visit. We're very picky about our Chinese food and love this place. The service is so great that even though a year can pass and the waitress remembers what I order to drink! Always love the food every time!

Ok this is my first yelp review, I never left any reviews for other restaurants, but I am writing it because I want others to know about this place more.

Restaurant run by family. very friendly, clean cooking environment, and Great food. I would come to this place again and again whenever I visit Pittsburgh.

Its less than 10min drive from Kennywood, if you are visiting Kennywood you should definitely try this place.

Defiantely the best Habachi I have ever had! When we went there last Wednesday we had the whole restaurant to ourselves and it was buy 1 habachi dinner get one half off. Not so much of a party atmosphere like normal Habachi restaurants but still a lot of fun! They dont shoot saki in your mouth so if your looking to get a little tipsy off some free saki this is not the place. Great service though! Highly reccomend it!!

Super friendly customer service!! The free sample was delicious although I couldn't name it. The owner immediately made me a new dish when I told him the beef was a bit overcooked and I would love to have some authentic Chinese food. I was happy with my food after all. The place is very clean - small but tidy restaurant. Strongly recommend it.

I have been coming to this place for years (since it opened). Never had a problem until recently you would get your money's worth. For a 4.95 lunch special you would get some sort of meat,fried rice,soup, and an egg roll. Now the same lunch is over 5.00  meal is alot smaller, and no soup. When I first went there there was people there and  3 cooks. Now I'm the only one there and only 1 employee running the register and cooking at the same time. The restaurant is dirty and looks like it hasn't been clean in a very long time.
Food is good price is right.  Needs to be a little cleaner and a fresh coat of paint.  In other words, TLC
Best Chinese take out in the area.  Nice staff and very fresh not so greasy food. Tasty!

Have been going here for years. The staff and owners are always very friendly and the food is great. The hibachi is some of the best around and my kids love the show. Overall it is a local treasure and we are lucky to have it.

Always quality, hot tasty food. And plenty of it for the cost.  Different than most typical take- outs with the same old wontons.  This family cares about the quality of the food and their customers.  My daughter lived in China and noted some of the popular Chinese restaurants in Sq. Hill were "legit" and good but Golden Dragon was still her favorite!
Friendly staff! Not a lot of seating in this place but it a takeout spot so go figure. I always order here, usually a go to Chinese food place.
Returned for the Japanese prepared at the table side of the restaurant. Not excellent, but a very good performance by the chef and decent food.

Excellent customer service. Very clean inside, very fast for take out, the sweet and sour chicken was delicious! 

Thank you, ladies!

Friendly staff and reasonable prices and portions. The entrees were good, but the crab rangoons weren't crunchy and the vegetable egg rolls were bland. They also got one of our orders wrong, giving us chicken instead of shrimp. I'd give them one more chance if I lived in the area and would update my review, but I was just passing through.

We tried this restaurant three years ago and it was so bad, I could not eat my meal.  I don't think there's any other time I can recall a meal so off for lack of a better word that I would not eat it.  So three years later I'm reading the decent reviews and think maybe it was just a bad night, they are so close, let's try take out.  Mistake.  We both took bites of common Chinese food take out dishes and stopped.  The food is not just bad, it tastes weird.  Then my husband told me the place smelled bad when he went to get it and was not clean.  We threw the food away.

There are nice little surprises you get when you're out and about, and one one such adventure of  "getting lost" as my wife likes to put our little accidental bits of tourism , we stumbled into a certain garden...

We are pleased:)

The Dragon Garden is a cozy, warm little place with a fair to middlin' bar (not really a sit down, but you can drinks to order,) and a really  tasty menu with forays into Thai, Szechuan, Cantonese and even a smattering of Vietnamese. 

The combo platters are priced right, the food is well done and tasty and you get a really good amount for...a really GOOD amount! Prices are great and the service was really fast. With pick up and dine-in, I heartily suggest stopping in for a bite or two for lunch or dinner. It won't break your bank and it'll make your taste buds happy you stopped by:)

This place is somewhat old school but I mean that as a compliment. Our waitress was friendly & perfectly attentive, the atmosphere was quiet and clean but the food .... I can't really say that it was bad because (in this situation) it comes down to personal preference rather than a bad meal. 
  I have been sick on & off for a week so this was thankfully the first meal I was able to eat without getting woozy afterwards. However, there were a lot of pieces (particularly the smaller ones) of orange chicken that were really tough! Like you're chewing on  leather  yet the larger pieces were delicious! I really enjoyed their take on orange sauce, not too sweet nor bland. But overall I didn't like my chicken, it tasted burnt to me & was more like crispy chicken skin rather than tender , juicy bites. My husband however, loved it! 
 So again, maybe it was just me. I would gladly be willing to give this place another chance. I just wish I could've taken my magic pot of tea with me... it was so good and relaxing that I just wanted to fall asleep in the booth and I felt so much better afterwards.
Love this place. Run by family. Best General Tso's around. And when I walk in they call me Mr. Spicy!

Very disappointed that they changed their delivery schedule to a time based system.
I have been a customer for years and now they lost my business over 3 minutes

People, pick one cuisine and stick to it! The massive multi-national, cluttered menu made it even more disappointing to have chosen such a poorly executed dish. Without exaggeration, the simple dish that was brought out seemed to be lathered in saliva. The chicken was pink. Downright nasty menu item! Can't speak for all five-hundred dishes, but can't imagine a more complicated entree being much better.

The coworkers and I partook in dinner here tonight. They have a few tables to sit down and done if you'd please, but it's really a takeout joint. I asked for spicy chicken hunan and the house special lo mein. I got small sizes, and they came with a pint of rice too. One small dinner was enough to fill my needs though, so be careful if you want leftovers. The two dishes were both made spicy and I loved the portions. Small pieces of meat mixed with larger portions. Vegetables were fresh, and the sauces were on point. Only paid 10$ for the two small dinners and I had half of each left. Takes them about 12 minutes to cook a meal if you are a walk in.
Really great food, fresh and flavorful. Love eating in as it is a unique dining experience. Give it a try  my pics are a hint want to expect.
Wonderful food, especially the General Tso chicken! Staff is friendly. Family loves the hibachi.

I cannot speak to the hibachi or sushi but the Chinese food at this establishment was some of the worst I have ever had. It tasted like all of the sauces came out of a can but even worse. I don't understand all the high ratings for this place if you've ever enjoyed good Chinese.
AMAZING food and hibachi! Sushi is fresh also! I reccomend war-su-gai OR hibachi filet and chicken!

Surprisingly awesome Hibachi and Sushi at this restaurant!!  If you are looking for Japanese food, this place is it!  The portions are huge and the food is fresh.  The combination platters are well priced with high quality ingredients.  I have to say that the sauces that come with the hibachi meals are the best in the area.  The chefs are a lot of fun as well!

I absolutely love this place. The service is always super friendly and upbeat. The food comes is incredibly well made. They offer amazing deals and offering delivery was the cherry on top. Highly recommended.

This is the absolute best Chinese food around!!! The staff is so friendly too (which is important in any business) also they sell lucky bamboo plants-which are healthier  & just more beautiful than Home Depot or any other place I've seen them. Besides having the best Hibachi & Chinese dishes the lucky bamboo plants all around (for sale) are just gorgeous & cheaper priced than I've seen. They also make great gifts!!! Love this place!!!

This family owned establishment has been a staple in the Nordonia Hills area for years.   The addition of sushi and hibachi have increased the greatness of the place.   Super reasonably priced, consistent good food and service make this a winner.

Been hear on numerous Times in my opinion it's the best Chinese restaurant in the Elyria area! Conveniently located in Chestnut Commons great for takeout inside atmosphere OK lunch buffet super. Would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who enjoys good Chinese food!

Typical Americanized Chinese food, but a high quality.  Not pretentious like PF Changs, but maybe not as well executed either.  Another "go-to" take out joint for my wife and I. The lo-mein has mushrooms which is a party foul for me, but other than that, everything is very good.
I have been looking for 3 years for good crab rangoon - I finally found it!!!  We had boneless ribs that were absolutely wonderful.  Definitely going back!!!

Been coming here for years. Best fried dumplings, egg foo young, & crab rangoons. However, getting a low score due to no delivery. I have to take the bus and this place is very inconvenient to get to due to route cuts.

Overall: I got take-out.  Food was good, and prices were very reasonable.

Food: 3 stars.  Hunan beef was good with lots of veggies.  Pork fried rice was average.  Wonton soup was good.  Teriyaki beef sticks were good but a little slimy so they needed to be cooked more.

Price: 5 stars.  Lunch combination meals are mostly $5.75 and dinner are $8-$9.  Wonton soup is $2.25 small and $4.00 large.  Teriyaki beef sticks $5.75.  Shrimp chips $1.

Appearance: 3 stars.  It's fairly large inside.  Decor is a tired Chinese restaurant cliche, and needs a refresh.

Service: 3 stars.  Gave me the food and I paid.

Been hear on numerous Times in my opinion it's the best Chinese restaurant in the Elyria area! Conveniently located in Chestnut Commons great for takeout inside atmosphere OK lunch buffet super. Would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who enjoys good Chinese food!
Yummy hibachi. Sometimes they don't have a chef on duty for it but when they do. Yay!

I was excited about the addition of Panda Express to steelyard commons as I am a big fan of Asian food and absolutely love pepper steak.  When I walked through the door I was instead greeted with a buffet style setting, all of which contained NO pepper steak, a major disappointment for me.  The only dish that looked remotely appetizing was the pepper chicken but this dish sadly contains peanuts and I am not a fan of peanuts in my food, another downer.  If you're looking for the traditional Chinese restaurant be hereby warned, this is NOT it!  The food is also overpriced in comparison to average Chinese restaurants and the portions are very small.  The food wasn't bad but nothing special either.  I wouldn't recommend unless you are on the go, really hungry and like buying overpriced food that isn't specially made for you!
Cash only & it was nasty. In a small shrimp with Chinese vegetables dish, there were a total of 4 shrimp and mostly cabbage that was as flavorful as cardboard.

Won't be back. I ordered the beef and broccoli, walnut honey shrimp, and chow mein. The chow mein was EXTREMELY oily. I had to prop the box  to the side so the oil would drain into one corner. I put napkins in the corner to absorb the oil. I removed one napkin after it was completely saturated and put another in. I had to do this 7 times before the oil stopped collecting in the corner of the box and each napkin was full of oil before I removed it. The coating on the shrimp was very mushy, the beef was salty with very few pieces.  The chow mein consisted of broken pieces of noodle and lots of cabbage and onion. The only good part was that there was a lot of broccoli and it was cooked perfectly. I noticed all of the locations have very low ratings. I'm not sure why they keep building locations but I suspect they won't be around long...

Great spot!  My husband and aun were in town visiting friends, seeing city sights and needed to "waste" time before our flight and this was a perfect find!!!! Had breakfast down the street at Pamela's then headed over for a nice massage. Very clean, all around the salon. Very quiet atmosphere. Leg & feet soaked massages upfront and body massages in private/curtain closed area in the back. Very professional and great massages. Also reasonable prices!
I've been going there for years! Best Chinese food in the area! My favorite is cashew chicken and basil tofu! You must try it!

I was actually excited to try Panda Express for the first time and got my usual go to of Kung Pao chicken.  The noodles were dry and bland and barely any meat in the bowl.  The only thing that tasted remotely good were the crab rangoon.  I'd rather go to a local Chinese spot any day.

Love Panda Express generally, just not this branch. Tried it for the first time about two weeks ago with my husband, and there just seemed to be a lot of tension between the staff, I wouldn't have minded but it costed us a 30 minute wait for our food. 
Tried tonight to see if the drive through would be any quicker, and it was.. BUT, I ordered the steamed veggies and the carrots are black? Honestly awful and inedible veggies, rather reluctant to return.

Has anyone seen Kitchen Nightmares? My husband and I ordered food to take away, and while we were waiting, a roach crawled right on the banquet in front of us like he owned the place. There is NEVER just one roach. We will never eat there again, YUCK.

Only getting one star because I have to! This was a terrible experience with horrible untrained service. We were waiting for 20 minutes because we had ordered something they were nearly out of. We saw multiple people come in and out and still ours was not ready. We had 3 plates and were only waiting on one. By the time the first item was ready they were out of the next! After 20 minutes I asked for my money back I was told they were short staffed and that was the problem. Then a manager comes out to give me my refund and asks what was the problem? I say well I've been waiting for 20 minutes and I'm done waiting. He then says they're having trouble with the grill and he just took over this store and he hopes I'll come back. I said no offense but I problem won't. He said "it is what it is". No wonder this store is a mess, they have a poor customer service model and obviously no training. Why would the manager be hanging out in back if the service line is a wreck? Poor management.
Visited Panda Express for the first time ever. The guy that helped me was sweet. Li was very nice and had great energy.
Good food and great prices.  Love the buffet for the price it's almost always packed at lunch time.
Some of the best Chinese food in the area. Great lunch deals, even on Saturday. Always fast hot  and ready when they say it is.

After running the half marathon my body was in all sorts of pain and ache. I came here on a whim as I was driving through squirrel hill, and I am glad I did. The interior is super clean and great service. I did not have an appt but they accommodated me promptly. I opted for the 30 minute foot massage + 30 minute body. I feel like they definitely went over the time limit. It's always a *good* sign when your masseuse can feel your back and *know* exactly where you're tight. The foot massage was great, but I thoroughly enjoyed the body massage the best. Will definitely be going back for the 1 hr body massage. Definitely worth the money!

Wow. Pulled up to the drive through 15 minutes before close and they said "would you like to know what we have left?". I asked if they do not keep their full menu available till close and they confirmed. Will not waste my time coming here again after now two bad experiences. The first time the food just wasn't prepared great. This time,  no food to even get.

GROSS. NO. NEVER AGAIN.

Just take one discerning look at your surroundings, and you'll never return. Discovering 100-year-old bits of dried food, bugs, dust, possibly bodily fluids, and duck sauce on every surface from the floor to the ceiling is enough to induce a dry (or wet!) heave. bslkfjasdfbb.

Don't expect to be able to recognize your food, either. Whatever you order, it'll be a tepid medium brown mess in a viscous sauce the consistency of hair gel. And your meat? Whatever it is, it'll be like biting into your maltipoo's chew toy. Just. Rubber.

I have to believe that the high ratings are coming from the 60+ crowd, who is fervently loyal to their known food establishments (and who also believe that sweet & sour chicken is a remotely authentic ethnic dish). 

My dear sexagenarian friends, you don't have to treat yourself this way! You deserve better than neon-colored, salty sauces and "egg rolls" (?!) fried to oblivion. There IS a world of delicious, fresh, and non-coma-inducing Chinese food out there! Though, of course, it's probably and sadly not in Northfield, or Summit County for that measure. Sigh. The search continues.
Food is good but I just learned that waitresses do not get to keep any part of THEIR tip! They have to hand it over to the owners. Isn't that illegal??
Best Chinese buffet in Elyria. Bourbon chicken is spectacular. Very comparable in price.

This place is amazing. Came here armed to spend a crap ton of money... 7 bucks for the buffet (1 drink included) *for an all you can eat .... free drinks (not just a drink) should be provided* had wanton soup, chicken on a stick, rice, spring and egg rolls... It's amazing! Don't know about their delivery bc I'm not lazy. The owner is nice (authentic fresh off the boat but speaks English), the Chinese dough nuts are not to be missed. Only thing that was weird is their rice insta pot.... not my style. I also wish that they had authentic plates and soup spoons..: but me and my tummy loved it!

You know how when you go to a place, pay a bunch of money for something that sounds awsslme but ends up being a ripoff? THIS WAS THE COMPLETE OPPOSITE. The massage was absolutely phenomenal and completely worth the price and then some. I got the 90 minute hot stone massage with a foot massage and it was awesome. I did it with the Groupon because it was my first time but I'd gladly go back. My shoulders were feeling tense all week and this massage worked out all my kinks and I feel great afterwards.

The lunch buffet is outstanding!
Everything is kept up with and very fresh. The owners are always there and extremely friendly. They have a full menu and offer delivery as well.

This place is amazing! My son and I have been several times and had both feet and body massages, which all were super! It is VERY clean, they are very professional and you get a great massage. It is also very affordable considering the quality and time you get. I usually call the day of but have also been able to walk in. That area of Murray typically has open parking. If you enjoy a massage, I definitely recommend you give it a try!

My girlfriend and I had 1-hour foot massages and they were fantastic! They had large comfortable reclining leather chairs and delicious tea. There was relaxing music playing too. 

The service began with a shoulder massage while our feet soaked in warm water. The foot massage released all the tension in my toes and feet. The optimal amount of pressure was applied to release muscles without causing pain. 

I've had a dozen or so foot massages prior and this place was definitely the best.

We visit Patrick and Janice at LEAST once a week. The food is consistently great and carefully prepared. It's always good. But what is as important to us is how warm, kind and genuine Patrick and Janice are, as is their small staff. They know their regulars and always greet us with a big welcome when we arrive. Wonderful family. Wonderful food.
Average at best..  had a egg roll and it was very greasy. The orange chicken again was very average.

Was trying to find a new Chinese spot in town... Guess ill have to keep looking.. 
What I got was ok but cold.  However a 2 hr delivery time (after being told 50 mins to an hr)  and the fact that my order was wrong, leads me to believe that this restaurant has terrible management and can not function as a viable business. Driver was unapologetic, fried rice was boring, crab rangoon was all cream cheese, fried wontons were over done and cold, and to top it off they forgot my fried dumplings. 
I appreciate the girl who answers the phone trying to help and giving me a "credit" towards my next meal but I definitely will not be using it. 
This was a big 2 thumbs down. Guess im going back to my old crap chinese food in town. at least they got my order right.

Great service! They offered to make me fresh Honey Chicken.

Would I go there again? Yes

We ordered take out for the family and it was horrible. I actually threw my meal away based on the smell when I opened the container. 2 meals were tried and tossed out after a few bites. You can guess the reaction they had that evening from those few bites. Never will order again even with other good reviews. Kind of sad I wanted it to be good being its close to home for us.

First time at this place and LOVED it. Better than the other local reflexology places I frequent often. Good relaxing vibe, very clean, great prices. Came for a body massage but it was so good we didn't wanna leave, so we stayed to add an a 30min foot, which was amazing! They use some kind of Burt's bees lotion for the foot massage. Will definitely be coming back here!

If you are ever in Northfield Ohio you must check this place out.
Great Chinese food, and the Hibachi I will put it right up against Fuji and its just as good and the price is way cheaper!

They do Sushi, Hibachi, and a killer variety of Chinese dishes.

Atmosphere is fantastic.

Feel Free to check out their menu here :  http://www.allmenus.com/oh/northfield-center/258366-dragon-garden/menu/
Love it! Food is great, employees are friendly, and the tables are super-cute! I've been there several times and I've never been disappointed!

If you are looking for a quiet private spa experience this may not be for you however if you're looking for a cute relaxing place I would definitely try. I never had reflexology done but wow it really was relaxing. The workers are friendly, offer you tea. You do sit in a row next to other people having services done but it still feels pretty private. They have a screened off area if you're going to get a massage and let me tell you they definitely know how to work out knots. Recommend! You could go for posh private spa but the level of expertise cannot be beat.
They had nothing vegetarian main entree to offer...just a side of mixed vegetables and spring rolls.. really?  Get with the times Panda Express!

I literally downloaded Yelp to review this. I came in right at close so I wasn't expecting the staff to be so upbeat and kind and helpful. They were out of what I wanted to order, so they made it fresh for me (very quickly) and it was perfect! Not sure if Russ is a manager or not- but if not, he should be! He was awesome!!
I work in fast food so I know how it can be when people come in at close- I was incredibly impressed with the amazing customer service I received.

Amazing massage! I had such a great reflexology experience with warm water at the begging and hot towels in the end with no additional costs. Atmosphere is clean and calm. The owner is really attentive is nice. They accept walk in which is awesome if you feel an unexpected pain but you also can make an appointment before. If you have an hour of reflexology they provide you a little massage in you shoulders at the begging and I really like that! Deep tissue massage os also provided but the strength depends on who will provide you the massage. I'm so glad that I found this place!

This place is the only Chinese food I eat! The owners are sweet people! I have eaten here for the Chinese, the Hibachi, and the Sushi! Everything is amazing! Yum Yum! we eat in, we take out no matter what they have never disappointed! I recommend! Hibachi is a great show too! If you haven't tried it, you should!

I read the reviews before I came and everybody seem to like this place...
I don't eat Chinese food often but today I was in the mood and when I walked in the lady at the desk has a HUGE SMILE the customer service was great! I paid 5.95 for the lunch buffet and the food was excellent and it comes with a drink ! . Such a great deal and this place is very clean ! I recommend this place to everyone !

I've been going here for years. Have tried 
Numerous Chinese restaurants in the Cleveland area. And I always come back to this one. The flavor of the food Is outstanding. They do a phenomenal take out service on weekends. Numerous orders. Service is great ,prices are good too !! You've got to try this place.

We finally broke away from our favorite Chinese take out place here in Elyria and tried Golden Bowl. So glad we did. Our old place had been letting us down for the last few months and our daughter wanted Sweet and Sour Chicken for dinner. Hubby suggested we try a new place. They were packing our food when my husband arrived to pick it up. It was piping hot and fantastic. Our combination dishes were cooked to perfection. The egg rolls weren't burnt, greasy or fishy tasting. We got plenty of fortune cookies and some tasty new hard candies. This is our new go to place for Chinese take out!

We have eaten in and had take-out at the Dragon for years.  We have also tried other Chinese restaurants in the area but we always come back to the Dragon.  We would highly recommend the Dragon - It has the best Chinese food we have ever had.

Costumer service was top notch. 4/5 stars for having to wait so long. Not upset about it because I know I was getting fresh food. If I were in a hurry, I probably would've changed my order to something already prepared since the wait was about 20 minutes for my order. Similar wait to ordering Chinese take out. I enjoyed an egg roll while I waited, and saw another costumer get a complimentary drink for waiting patiently. The staff is vibrant and helped pass the time quickly. They had all the costumers waiting for their food in light; fun conversation. When you donate to the charity, they ring a bell and all shout thank you. It was one of the most enjoyable food waits I've ever experienced. 

Russ recommended the Beijing Beef (sample was delicious and I ordered it) and they really loaded me up with food ! 

I got teriyaki chicken (that they cut and sauce in front of you), Beijing beef, fried rice, and cho mein
Ordered Hunan chicken to go.  It was prepared with very little flavor.  Very poor attempt at this dish.
Great place and great service! Must say they are professionals. Like the location, the massage was really amazing. Loved the tea. Will definitely be back

Very friendly staff.  Food was really good.  The portions are great.  The kids got the combo platters that came with fried rice and egg rolls, great price.  We ordered from the House Specials portion of the menu, the container was packed full of meat and seafood.  All veggies were fresh.
I have gone here for 15 years or more, have not once had a bad meal! They are so kind and caring with their service! Love supporting local places like this!!! Keep it up dragon garden!!

So this was my first time at this location. I was familiar with this brand and thanks to Tmobile, I gave this location a try. 
This weeks Tmobile Tuesdays deal was a free orange chicken bowl! I had to use by today or forfeit.
I had to do an online order for pickup to redeem. No big deal, right? WRONG! It kept getting stuck at the last step which is place order.
Now that i finally got it to work after backing out 4 times, I pick up my order and it is wrong. I double checked my receipt and it was correct there, just not in my bag. I ate it anyway as I didn't want them to throw the food away. 
The food was pretty good, not great but i wonder if they made my order immediately and let it sit. 
All things considered, the bowl was free so I'm a happy girl. Next time, i will eat inside though.

I don't know if Jalyssa that works the drive-thru is a manager there but she should probably be CEO of the whole operation. She has a great and very helpful attitude.

That's all I got. They're not all novels. Sometimes you just gotta shout out a young lady working hard and being very kind in the face of what I'd assume is not an easy gig.

Black Pepper Chicken is always on point.

I like this place. It's nice, clean, actually Immaculate, and have very nice employees. However, I was not prepared for not having a private room with walls and a door. I also was not prepared for having people talking on the other side of the very well-curtained massage room. I'm actually used to having professional massages in a private room with walls and a door, in either total silence, or with soft instrumental background music. My massage therapist, Mickey, spoke almost no English, did not know sign language which I used to teach, but frequently asked me in broken English if I was okay. I learned that the receptionist who is a very charming and very friendly young woman, spoke fluent English, lived in the neighborhood, and could translate for the client. I wish I had known that before my massage. I thought I recognized that the employees on the other side of my curtain, were speaking Mandarin. They were. But I haven't spoken or heard Mandarin since I was 10 years old, 47 years ago. So my Mandarin was very rusty. O.k. Non-existent. 

I used a Groupon,  which I usually do when trying a new massage or hair salon. Sometimes, when you use a Groupon, you  don't get the level of service that you would if you had paid full price. I know this isn't fair, and I know that this is not good customer service, but this is what happens sometimes. It's on the business, not on Groupon. Fortunately, that was not the case with my massage. Mickey was thorough, and really worked my muscles.  I wasn't asked, but  I received a deep tissue massage. That was good for what my issues were, but different massages are beneficial for different issues. So it's always nice when the massage therapist asks what your issues are or what kind of a massage you would prefer. I'll tell you, for one tiny little Asian woman, she spared no expense with eradicating all the tense, stiff, or sore muscles I had. I felt great, but a bit sore. Totally understandable. I went home and took another Epsom salt bath. I drank copious amounts of water for the rest of the day and the next. It's part of my ritual detox following a massage. Before a massage, I drink a cup of green tea with a touch of honey, then a bottle of water, and enjoy an Epsom salt bath by candle light. This routine makes my massages more beneficial.

When I go back, I'll make sure the receptionist tells my masseuse  (I didn't see any men except for one in a parka) what my issues are and the massage I'd like.  I'll also try to book an appointment when it's quiet and not busy, as I like a quiet massage.  I admit, I just lay there like an amoeba during my massage. I usually don't talk unless I'm asked a question. I just lay there, focus on my breathing, and enjoy the experience. And this is a good place to do just that.

First and last time my husband will b going here. Upon going to the drive thru he was asked if he been there to eat before and told the young lady no, she advised him to come inside instead to order so he could understand the menu, I'm guessing. Well my husband is a disable hg

Last time I didn't have a good experience: wrong schedule, bad painful massage (not that "good pain that you feel relaxed and better). The guy who massage me used to massage my feet bones instead of muscles and I realized sometimes he was killing time by going to take something somewhere or cleaning my feet for long time In my opinion he doesn't have a good technique for massage. I'm not sure if I would come back again because this is already the second bad massage I had with the same guy. And my pain level? It increased! That's too bad!!

Finally decided to stop by for my first massage a couple of weeks ago and I've already gone twice. I love the availability of therapists for walk ins. The environment is casual and relaxing. The staff are very friendly. Some of the best massages I've had and the rates are great. Can't wait to go back!
Very quiet and clean, was able to get two appointments for body massages the same day. The prices were great as well. Will definitely be coming back!

I love a good massage. I am very particular when it comes to my relaxation.  I want it to be a quiet, clean, comfortable space, and a comfortable price. Feet Paradise Reflexology checks all of the boxes.  I was able to find parking on the street easily.  The space was clean and smelled very nice. There were signs telling you that it is a quiet space, the air conditioner was running so that helped it seem like they had a noise canceling machine. Which I think would be an excellent addition. The bathroom was down the hall away from the massage area and was very clean with cute decorations.  
The massage starts with a foot soak in warm water with rose petals and a back, neck, head massage. 
I opted for the hour foot massage. You are covered with a blanket and the leg not being massaged is covered with a towel.  She used a nice thick lotion to massage away the stress in my feet and legs.  She massaged my feet and legs up to my knees. The massage made my feet and legs feel refreshed! The leather chair reclines and it is perfection. I found myself drifting off to sleep a few times.  
I was a walk in client and I was able to be seen almost instantly, but I was a Tuesday around 1pm. I can not wait to go back!

Wow! 
This place is Awesome with a capital A.
Worth. Every. Single. Penny.
Came here two times so far and will definitely be back many many more.
First time a 90 minute massage (30 min feet,60 min body)
Second time 60 minute foot.
Strong hands and they clearly know what they are doing.
Big comfy chairs for the foot massages they recline so you can lay back and relax.
The full body massage is in a curtained off area next to the chairs.
More than enough privacy.
The sitting up back massage I received before the 60 min foot massage was on point.
Could have had that for an hour alone.
Made my neck feel much better.
Right on Murray Ave which has its up and downs.
Super convenient location
Downside is that the door opens right to the noisy street, so at times you are relaxing and someone walks in and you hear all the buses/cars and people going by.

You can make an appointment right through the yelp app. They respond almost instantaneously. 

Now to the nitty gritty.
I very rarely use Groupon. This was only my second time using it. 
For the 30 min foot/60 min back I had a groupon.
Then I kept getting emails from Groupon prompting that the massage place added new deals.
I probably got 5 or 6 emails in one week promoting the massage place. 
So I was like okay it's my birthday why not get one for me and my mom.
So we purchased two 60min foot massages.
Came in on March 29 (aka my birthday)
Had excellent massages.
Went to pay and showed her the Groupon.
She said we can't use them because it's for first time customers only. 
I'm like okay, I didn't see that.
She pulls out a paper of the Groupon deal and it's apparently in the fine print.
Raise your hand if you ever read the fine print 
No one does. Should we? Of course. But we don't.
So clearly this has happened to other people who go there. 
So i think it's time to take it out of the fine print and move it up to the actual deal description. 

 I asked if I could use my mothers Groupon at least because she didn't use one at our last visit just me.
She said no you have to be first time customers.
Okay whatever, we paid, no problem.
But honestly we are returning customers and clearly we are going to be people who come back many times. 
Better to keep customers happy. 

It was a big hassle with Groupon. 
They wanted to give us credit instead of refunding us. But since I rarely use Groupon a credit would be useless. After sitting on countless holds the Groupon guy finally decided to give us a refund.

And okay, okay I know people hate Groupon they think it makes the person cheap. But if the place doesn't want people to use a Groupon don't have Groupon deals. 
I was just getting bombarded with promotion emails which is why I even purchased it a second time.

Anyhow, massage place is great massage wise.
They just need to fix their Groupon issues.

First time at this place and LOVED it. Better than the other local reflexology places I frequent often. Good relaxing vibe, very clean, great prices. Came for a body massage but it was so good we didn't wanna leave, so we stayed to add an a 30min foot, which was amazing! They use some kind of Burt's bees lotion for the foot massage. Will definitely be coming back soon!

I was told that my $30.00 order was TOO MUCH for the drive through register to handle. That if I needed to place an order that big I need to come inside. RUDE employees and terrible customer service. Won't return that's for sure.

Oh my goodness!!!
It's not my first foot massage place but this place is now my standard 
10 years on yelp ...
This was my best and I mean best foot reflexology experience ever.
The guy knows what he is doing and that's not to be taken lightly. He really knows the spots to push the spots for pressure the spots for lighter
So good so relaxing 
The place is sparse. It's a bit bright who cares the reflexology was so good I could have been sitting on a rock in the bright sun and I would still be ok
Big fat comfy chairs all in one room
They do have privacy curtained sections for body
Warm foot bath followed by hot towels reflexology finished with a bit of shoulder and back 
Pure heaven
45 for an hour of feet and it's so worth it. Friendly girl at the desk it's all good 
Call for an appointment because that's what I do though I think they take a walk-in 
I'll be back as soon as I can

Dirty restaurant. Poor service. Food was NOT good at all. We had only walked in and grabbed a menu from the front and ordered off it while waiting for laundry in the area. Had we walked into the actual restaurant, we never would have ordered. 
For the amount of food, the prices were too high. We ordered a seafood dish and had 2 shrimp and 2 scallops in it. Otherwise all vegetables.
Had to walk back in to get silverware for a to go order because they forgot to put it in there. Also took about 10 min longer than communicated. Would not go here again if in the area. Also got sick off of my order. Only bright spot was the seafood soup. The soup had more seafood in it than the actual dish...

They have been very nicely at accommodating my request for an appointment for my boyfriends birthday, even though originally the whole day was booked up. The massages was great and I loved that they provided cupping and other extra service. Definitely relaxed our sore muscles!

their food and noodles are very authentic, but one thing freaks me out every time is this place does not provide the customers with receipt. maybe most of the customers don't even care but I am a person who would like to document my spending, and this can really be a reason that drives me away. the charge is already more expensive if you use a credit card than if you pay with cash, then why they can't give customer receipt? I had a similar experience with going with ÃæÃæ¾Ó, as I had to have a "talk" with the cashier every time in order to get my own receipt, after a few time, I just walk away. I though Mid-summer lounge can be a nice replacement, but it turned out the same way. I think they loose me not because of their food, but because of their operation and service. 

Õâ¸öµØ·½µÄÃæÌõÊÇ·Ç³£µØµÀµÄ£¬µ«ÊÇÃ¿´ÎÈ¥Ëû¼Ò³ÔÎÒ¶¼ÒªÒòÎªÄÃ²»µ½ÊÕ¾Ý¶ø·¢¿ñ¡£¿ÉÄÜÆäËû¿ÍÈË²¢²»ÔÚÒâÕâ¸ö£¬µ«ÊÇÎÒÊÇÏ°¹ßÊÕÁôÆ½Ê±µÄÏû·ÑµÄÊÕ¾ÝµÄ¡£ÔÚÕâÀï³ÔÃæÌõ£¬Èç¹ûÄã¸¶ÐÅÓÃ¿¨£¬ÄÇÃ´ÄãµÄÊÕ·ÑÒÑ¾­±È¸¶ÏÖ½ð¸ßÁË£¬ÄÇÓÖÎªÊ²Ã´²»¸ø¿ÍÈËÊÕ¾ÝÄØ£¿ÎÒÖ®Ç°Ò²¹â¹Ë¹ýÐ£Ô°ÉÏµÄÁíÒ»¼Ò"ÃæÃæ¾Ó"£¬ÒòÎªÃ¿´Î¶¼ÒªÌØ±ðÏòÊÕÒøÔ±"Çó"ÊÕ¾Ý£¬¼¸´ÎÒÔºóÎÒÕæµÄ¾õµÃÐÄÀÛ£¬Ö®ºó¾Í²»ÔõÃ´È¥ÁË¡£Mid-summer lounge¿ªÁËÒÔºó£¬ÎÒÒÔÎªÕâ¼Ò»áºÃÒ»µã£¬µ«Ã»Ïëµ½½á¹ûÊÇÒ»ÑùµÄ¡£ÎÒ¾õµÃÈç¹ûÔÙÕâÑùÏÂÈ¥£¬ÕâÀïµÄÊ³ÎïÎÞÂÛ¶àºÃ³ÔÎÒÒ²²»»áÈ¥ÁË¡£ÎÒÖ»ÊÇ²»ÄÜÀí½â±¾Ó¦ÊÇÊôÓÚÏû·ÑÕßµÄÈ¨Àû£¬ÎªÊ²Ã´µê¼ÒÄÜÄÇÃ´ÀíÖ±Æø×³µÄÄÃ×ß¡£

Absolutely fantastic food. My boyfriend hates Chinese but he loves to come here with me and get General Tso's chicken. Their Sushi rolls are beyond phenomenal. I could stuff myself for hours on just the sushi here. I am so glad they made this old Pizza Hut into an awesome Chinese sit-down restaurant.

"The New" How Lee is a great example of just how much the food scene in Pittsburgh has developed and grown over the past decade. Not so long ago, How Lee's was a down-and-dirty corner joint turning out strictly mediocre Americanized Chinese fare for take-out only. So I was pleasantly surprised to find that it has been transformed into a sit-down restaurant serving exhilaratingly spicy and flavorful Sichuan dishes.

With two dining partners, I sampled the dan dan noodles, the garlic eggplant, and the Sichuan prawns. The noodles were pleasantly chewy and luxuriously bathed in the sesame-rich sauce studded with bits of ground pork. The eggplant had a tinge of sweetness nicely countered by the sharp garlic and swirls of chili oil. The prawns were dry-fried with several cups of dried chilis. The fresh sweetness of the shrimp balanced perfectly with the saltiness and spice of its seasonings.

The service was friendly and prompt, and our server checked on us several times to make sure we were pleased with our meal and to see if we needed anything further.

The New How Lee is a wonderful addition to the Squirrel Hill food scene and I'd be more than happy to dine there again.

The double cooked "pork belly with capsaicin (pepper) spice" is TO DIE FOR. If you like bacon and a little heat, you'll love this. The Sichuan lunch specials--all under $8 served with fried/white/brown rice and choice of soup...Also, the place is clean and its location in Squirrel Hill makes it a destination rather than just some place to grab a bite. Plenty of shops and nice things to see along Murray and Forbes.

A nifty little Asian place hidden behind the usual chain joints in Brooklyn (where my girl was raised...however, I represent Queens). Huge selection, friendly staff, good drink specials. I got the lo mien, and it was far, far beyond the usual rubbery shizzle that passes for lo mien in most restaurants. On a Thursday night, it was surprisingly dead, but this place is a welcome and unexpected surprise.

Yum yum hot pot. Lots of options. Secret to enjoy is to try out various combinations of the sauces and then stick with one if you are new to the whole hot pot concept.

I had lamb with mushroom broth base.

Disgusting. 

Oily. 

No seasoning. 

My husband just picked up $60 of take out. After sampling each item I found unhappy similarities. Salt apparently is unheard of. Grease is abundant. And how the heck do you mess up fried rice?!?! My hot and sour soup was tasteless and vinegary. $10 for steamed veggies in soy sauce? Soggy chow fun. Pork filling in the dumplings was just pork. Egg roll greasy and doughy.

bleeeeeech. 

Never again. Can I have our $$ back? Also could someone bring me dinner as this was inedible.

I stopped here because I needed to get from this neighborhood to the Northside and it was 4:30 in the afternoon on a weekday and I didn't want to sit in traffic. When I got there, there was no buffet and no one to take my order. I was about to leave, thinking that maybe they weren't open. This Lady walked out from the back room (kitchen?) talking on her phone. She asked me if I wanted to order some food. I told her that that was my general intention. I asked if it was an eat-in restaurant because there were only 3 tables and 2 couches. She seemed surprised that I wanted to eat there. She said I could be served at the table. I ordered the crab rangoon and that was pretty good, went to eggdrop soup and again not bad but a little plain. It needed salt but they didn't have any. I asked for some soy sauce and got 2 little packets. I got General Tso and it was a little too sweet with no heat. I'm finding this trend in several Chinese restaurants. So, all in all, it was ok but this place is geared for takeout.
Ordered delivery and it was quick! I ordered crispy shrimp with broccoli and it was delicious. This might just become my new favorite place to order from

Okay.  So this is some of the best food... and one of the best dining experiences I've ever had in madison.... till the very end when I found a really long hair in my food...  I pulled it out right in front of the host and he didn't acknowledge it.  This is the only thing preventing me from giving them 5 stara.  Aside from that that- the broth was flavorful, the veggie plate plentiful, and noodle and continent bar very generous. The great thing about this style of cooking is the evolution of the flavors.  As you add things and take them out the flavor palate changes, grows.

I ordered food from How Lee because my fav chinese restaurant in Pittsburgh changed owners and is no longer up to par. I ordered around 4:30pm on a Tuesday. Estimated delivery time was 45 minutes, which is average for most places. It had snowed a little and the roads were salted, but I can see taking a little caution, so we gave them an hour and 15 min before we called. I live in Oakland, so we're abt 2 miles away. Our food didn't show up until 6:15 and was lukewarm at best upon arrival. We also found the flavoring to be mediocre compared to others we've tried. We will not be ordering from them again.

BEST WONTON SOUP! After eating theirs no other wonton soup will compare! Always super fresh and delicious! Their egg rolls are superb! Love the moo goo gui pan and sweet and sour chicken is always a hit!! Absolutely Delicious! Never had a bad tasting item from here! We've been enjoying their cuisine for over 12 years

Some of the best dumplings I've had, but the service has some kinks to work out.  I get the impression that they aren't fully ready to be open.

First the bad stuff.  There's no menu (in English, anyway) and the experience is not streamlined.  They take your order at the register, but insist that you pay after eating, which feels pretty awkward.  There were little cups for sauces, but no lids, so we had to ask for our takeout order.  After coming back a second time, there was no one who could speak English working so the nice and friendly lady working the register had to ask some customers to play translator.  The place barely looks open and when you walk in you think, "Am I supposed to be here?"

Good stuff: the dumplings/buns are great and fairly priced.  The interior is pleasant and nicely decorated.  I like the understated nature of the food.  It feels like hearty home-cooking style food.  The dumpling fillings are simple but well-implemented.  Very juicy and flavorful.  

Menu, since it's not currently posted:

Dumplings: $8.50 for ~14
Pork w nappa cabbage
Beef with green onion (really really good)
Beef with carrot

Buns: $1.50 each
Pork w nappa cabbage
Lamb with carrot
Beef with green onion
Beef with carrot

In summary, great food at great prices, but it's currently strange to eat there, especially if you don't know Chinese.  I'm not knocking off any stars for that because I found it kind of charming, but if it sounds like something that would bother you, you might want to wait until they get situated and better figure out their workflow.

How Lee is awesome, and a very legit Chinese/Sichuan restaurant (from my whitey perspective). Went out to eat there with two friends on a Saturday night, waited for 15 minutes, and loved being a minority amongst tables of Asians. Servers were nice and quick. 

Fried scallion pancakes off the American menu were homemade and epic. We had the cucumber salad (don't bother, it was bitter - like when cucumbers have that bitter skin). Beef chow fun was delish, though the beef was unsurprisingly un-beef like (but not gross or gristly). Plenty of tasty egg bits and crunchy onions and other things. On the Sichuan menu, we had the sichuan kung pao chicken with peanuts. It was delish, great sauce. We tripped out on the weird taste in our mouths that made water taste totally bizarre. Then I noticed a clove-sized spice in the sauce, chewed on one and half my mouth did something crazy. We asked our server: "pickled ash, numbs your mouth." Sweeeet! I love encountering new shit at a restaurant. I also noted the brilliance of putting in a numbing agent to counter the red chili spice. 

In case you're curious, I Wiki'd pickled ash, and it's PRICKLY ASH. Here's the story: "The fruit of several species of Zanthoare used to make the spice Sichuan pepper. They are also used as bonsai trees. Historically, the bark was widely used for toothache, colic, and rheumatism."

Dinner for three was $42 including tip. Goddamn that's cheap!

Two nights later, even though I'd just bought $60 of organic produce from Whole Foods, I ordered How Lee delivery. Veggie dumplings were delicate and yummy; can't wait to try them in the restaurant. Tea-smoked duck was tasty, smoky, fatty, and worth the try - split it with two others. 

China Palace can now go straight to hell for their uninteresting, bland and overpriced American Chinese.  Go to How Lee, you will also become addicted.

Five of us (two adults and three teenagers) ordered takeout from the Rice Inn. We ordered four meals and one appetizer, and the portions were enormous! The food was very good, and there were leftovers for the next day. While we didn't dine in, we were impressed by the interior of the restaurant (very clean and inviting), and think the next time we will dine in and sit at the sushi bar. Service was extremely friendly and fast. I did note that the restaurant is BYOB, with a cork fee, but that's just an FYI. Overall, we enjoyed the food a lot, and we will eat there again.

I don't know what happened to them. How Lee used to be my favorite Chinese place. I ordered Tri pepper chicken as usual.... The dish was smelly, and I had to spit out half of the chicken because it was too chewy and it hurt my jaw to chew. Did they get a new chef or something? Absolute disappointment..

HOW LEE CRAP WHAT TERRIBLE SERVICE

They took two hours to deliver my food and I missed my event because of them. They did not bother telling us they were gonna be delayed
I get takeout from this place all the time, and it's always quick and hot when it gets to me!  The lo mein and dumplings are really good! Would definitely recommend!

Excellent food all around! We had a little bit of everything - and nothing disappointed us. We had sushi - excellent flavors, perfectly presented. Vegetarian egg rolls - perfect. Chicken with noodles that we asked to be mildly spicy - my mouth still drools thinking about it.
Definitely go - it's worth the price.

Came here for my first hot pot experience and it did not disappoint! I do recommend getting the spicy broth as my husband tried the mushroom and was underwhelmed ... so he started just cooking everything in mine since it was super yummy! They have a sauce bar which had plenty of choices and I enjoyed making different dipping sauces to find what I liked best. The meat was great quality and they give you a small variety plate with your order of other items to sample as well. We ended up ordering extra mushrooms and broccoli after having the sample! It did seem a little bit pricey compared to other places where I had seen hot pot on the menu but we left happy and stuffed so can't really complain. Will definitely be back when I'm in the Madison area!

The food is so good! I recommend the fish fillet soup. I have had two kinds of the fillet soup but don't remember the exact name. The service is great as well. Been here twice and have not been disappointed. I think they were close to closing and even though they ran out of the item I wanted, they made an exception. Super sweet of them and the noodles were yummy as usual. Cannot wait to be back here again!

Ordered from Silk Pagoda using GrubHub since we were unable to sneak away from the office... WORST EXPERIENCE EVER!  Not only did the order take forever, but most of the items were incorrect.  We had to call to get the order rectified... and when  we did, they still did not get it right and it took forever.  

The food was completely disappointing and the service was even more awful since they did not even seem the slightest bit apologetic about the mishap.  

If you want good chinese food delivery, there are better options.

I'm truly a fan of this place, but only during the school year.   I've brought my two kids (5 & 8) here several times, and they LOVE the dumplings, as do I.  They are delicate, delicious and everything a dumpling should be.   We come here when they have a long weekend, or march break, or thanksgiving break... and everytime, the dumplings are amazing and the service is fantastic -- our orders come out within 10 minutes of ordering.   We came here last week -- first full week of school was off.   The place wasn't that busy -- maybe 5 tables full.... there were 2 tables ahead of us who were waiting.   Twenty five minutes later (and I had the call ticket that showed when my food was order) and there was still nothing.   My kids were starting to complain that they were starving... heck, I was starving.   I go up to the young man at the counter and ask where our dumplings were.   He said, "our dumplings our made fresh to order, so you have to wait.".  I told him that we are regular customers and have never waited more than 10 minutes for our dumplings.   The young man again argued, "but we make them fresh and we are busy".    There are two tables ahead of us, and they both ordered Noodle Soups!?  And he just argued, "they take time, so we will bring them to you when they are ready.".   (WTF?!?!?!)   The dumplings eventually came about 5 minutes later, and they were luke warm at best.   Not pleased.    Am hoping that they get rid of the front guy and bring back the nice lady who wears her hat sideways.....

I'll admit I'm pretty picky about Asian food and there's nothing worse than being disappointed! I was hesitant to try Rice Inn because I already had a go to Chinese place, but many friends liked it and I was craving Pad Thai and they had a lunch special that included Pad Thai. I threw caution to the wind and went for it one afternoon for lunch. I ordered both Pad Thai with chicken and a Szechuan Chicken with steamed rice so my dining partner and I could try a little each. 

The portion size was really generous on both. The Pad Thai was a little more saucy than I'm used to and was a different color than I'm accustomed, but it was pretty good and satisfied a craving. The meat was very good. Thinly sliced chicken breast was cooked perfectly. The dish had a pleasant spice level, too. I could have used a little more bean sprouts in the dish, but the snow peas were an interesting addition. 

The Szechuan chicken was also good. Again, great quality meat- no gristle and mystery pieces here! I should have asked about the vegetables that were included because this one had a lot of bell pepper which I don't really care for. That's not their fault, I forgot to ask. There were bamboo shoots and carrots, too. All in all, a good dish. 

I'd definitely go back to try a few other things. They have sushi and a few other Thai offerings, mostly curries. 

The place is a converted Pizza Hut building, and nothing fancy, but it was clean, bustling like you'd hope at lunch time, and very pleasant staff. Easy parking with a parking lot surrounding the building.

Their customer service was excellent, so I really do not want to give a bad review, BUT... Frankly their food is not that good. I don't even know if you can call it Americanized Chinese food. The biggest problem I had was the complete lack of spice in the dishes marked as spicy. They tasted SWEET more than anything. And while their portions are huge, they aren't cheap by any means. As I mentioned, they are really friendly though, and since the place seems fairly kids-friendly, I might eat there every once in a while regardless.

The food I had was really Good so I was just about to be their new daily customer when I came back. This time I ordered online and the online menu was different and my order was incorrect. I know that things happen but what matters is how you deal with them. Typical greedy money grubbing Chinese takeout place threw a foreign language fit and raised hell to fix my order and at first refused until I refused payment! 

It's also expensive for greasy Chinese.

Stay away from this place. I will be eating American from now on and bashing this place to my friends at school....

I have eaten at this restaurant a few times and was appalled by the food the last time. I ordered Kung pao chicken and literally half of the meal was dried red peppers.  There were also chunks of raw ginger in the "mix" which was quite unappealing. This meal reminded me of why I don't eat out too often. I ordered hot & sour soup but was served won ton soup. It wasn't bad.

If you want some AUTHENTIC Chinese food, this is where to get it! How Lee was the epitome of a bland American Chinese food takeout place before they renovated the restaurant. After they renovated their entire place and the menu items, there is the closet place for authentic Chinese food in the Pittsburgh area! Some of my favorites are their spicy fish filet in hot broth and the spicy fried chicken (La Zi Ji). Very popular Sichuan dishes. Their food can be quite spicy, so don't forget to ask for less peppers. 

Never mind what I say, just look at how there's always a line out around dinner time on weekends! And it's always packed with Chinese people. You know it's legit when the place is packed with a lot of Chinese people :D

Fun place. they give you a ton of food and the noodle/potato/sauce bar helps to minimize clutter on the small tables. if you like spicy, i would go for either the szechuan or the thai style broths. i was curious about the coconut curry broth but it was underwhelming. spent too much time trying to add various sauces and spices to the broth. would be curious to go back to see if they would give me a bowl of mixed coconut curry/thai shrimp broth b/c that's what i ended up doing at the table.

They definitely have a better idea of how to handle spicy dishes well compared to most Chinese restaurants. The dandan noodles is a must try. There's a hint of peanut taste in there but it doesn't overpower the general flavor of the noodles. The spicy fish fillet tastes amazing. Might have been the best I've had in Pittsburgh so far. My only complaint is that their twice cooked pork tastes a bit too salty and greasy.

So I just moved to bethel park not too long ago and had no idea where to get Chinese ! Taking a shot in the dark I ordered Rice Inn ! I must say I was not disappointed . The food is beyond delicious and the staff is always so nice ... in addition to the Chinese , they also have great sushi and Thai food as well. The spicy Thai basil is my favorite .
Went there for the schezuan. The food was way too salty. The spice was ok , i didn't think it was flavorful.
Brought my three children for a Sunday night meal and we were so happy with our dinner. Even our I-hate-soup 9 year old loved the food. The proprietors are friendly and the service was great.

We moved here last year from Los Angeles and overnight our diets changed. It's not that I don't love your fried cheese curds, Wisconsin, but I miss the comfort foods of home. While we found good tacos here within a week or so, finding real hot pot seemed unlikely. We saw the sign for this place go up a month or two before it opened, got excited but didn't want to give our hopes up. But it ended up being exactly what we'd hoped for. This place is a dream. Delicious, reasonably priced, exactly right. While I still miss the variety you get at Little Sheep-type hot pot in LA, I definitely don't miss spending 30 dollars a person. Mini Hot Pot gives you a big platter of veggies and tempura and rice cakes and endless noodles at their noodle bar. Go for the spicy broth, it's the tastiest. Their sweet potato noodles (vietnamese) are my favorite. And I love the new coconut broth because you can flavor it and spice it however you want from the spice bar. The service is super-friendly and everyone is so helpful and patient there with questions. Every time we go, it's like being a little closer to home. I hope they keep getting the recognition they deserve.

I love this place; the mood is intimate and the workers are kind. Their noodles are oily but delicious and that's what i feel is authentic. their style of noodle tastes like a mix between buckwheat and classic chinese flour noodle. The establishment is niche in noodle and dumplings and it does it very well. The portions are fair for the price and i always have left overs, which is best packed separately, broth from noodles, to maintain the chewiness of the noodles. i just can't stop coming back here!

I disagree with the low star comments here; when I was there last week, the quality of service was definitely not 1 star, not to mention that they don't even take tips. I don't mind getting food from the counter myself or putting bowls and plates back. You get what you pay for. 

That being said, I think the most important thing about restaurant is their food, which was superb. They have dumplings here that are just delicious.
Average at best. There's nothing that really stood out, but I wasn't expecting much from an Asian restaurant located off the highway exit to one of Cleveland's inner-ring suburbs.

This place is the bomb, and I'm Asian. Why this is a good place to try hotpot if you are a first timer or non-Asian:

1. You don't have to deal with the gross idea of sharing a single pot with a table and everyone sticking their germs into your hotpot. 
2. And you don't have to have conflicts with what flavored soup to get when sharing. Everyone gets their own! 
3. The menu is simple and pretty American-friendly. They don't give you weird Asian ingredients like livers/intestines, so you can order freely without worrying about eating something you are uncomfortable with
4. There's a salad bar at the back where you can get noodles and basic veggies! Awesome, places often charge for that.

I can't believe this used to be a Pizza Hut. Awesome service and food. I loved the sushi, but especially their Honey Walnut Shrimp. The food is a mixture of Thai, Japanese, and Chinese. It's near a strip mall, so there's lots of parking.

Wow this place is great!  So different. So interesting.  The flavors, which you select and create are amazing. 
Just recommend cooking your own, and then letting it cool!  And maybe add sauce to broth. 
We had everything, and it was ALL good!!!
Come. Enjoy.

How did I never review this place before? ONLY order off the traditional Sichuan style menu on the back page, and you cannot lose. We eat here so often. My fav items are The Chingqing dumplings and I always reserve the sauce it's in to put over the rice since it is SO good. I love the beef and fish hotpots (this is the only meal I prefer in restaurant than take out).  The baby bokchoy is garlic heaven, and the stir fried green beans  and salty and pork-y. The eggplant is also good as is the spicy dry hot chicken.  We have never gone wrong with the Sichuan menu; plus ask a server for a suggestion.  Ooooh, and it is byob.
