Everything well marked, quickly replenished (always crowded at lunch, which I guess is a good sign, with a steady stream of take-out as well) and so relatively fresh. You will probably have to wait a bit at lunch for a table. $7 plus tax.
Really impressed!  The sushi is delicious. So excited that we have a quality sushi house about 2 minutes away from our home. The staff is super friendly as well.

Ordered the shrimp crepe,  shrimp wonton and dumpling soup,  9pc pot stickers,  and beef fried rice all for a grand total of. .. $20!

 The shrimp crepe are steamed shrimp in a gluttonous pillow of dough and comes with a side of dark sauce. The soup was a clear and very light broth filled with Napa cabbage and generous portions dumplings and shrimp wonton. The beef fried rice was as healthy as fried rice comes in a Chinese establishment with thick slices of beef,  green onions,  and scrambled eggs. My partner remarked how it was plain,  and in a good way. 

The pot stickers are where it's at!  They are pan fried,  golden pockets of perfection.  You can tell they were not dumped in the fryer from a frozen state,  rather formed by detailed and skilled hands and fresh ingredients were used in these little edible purses. 

We came in on a weeknight around 6:30pm ( they close at 7pm) and there was a table of three dinning in and mild traffic for take-out. 

I can't speak for the bakery items since they were all but gone when we arrived.  A good excuse to go back again!

I like Asian Sweet Bakery, but their foods have been inconsistent so far. So, it is kinda hit or miss. But, with that price, I would not complain that much, thus the four-star rating. 

When I come here, I always have:
1. red bean bun (soak it with unsweetened soy milk or milk)
2. sponge cake (eat it with tea)
3. fried pork dumpling (come as early as 11am, otherwise they are gone)
4. Porridge with Chinese donut

Skip the mooncake (too sweet for my taste, and it is not the mooncake that I had in the past)

Empress Court has always been a part of my life (literally) and I have to stop every time I'm visiting my home town. It's an older restaurant, but it's the best Chinese food you'll find in the Chagrin Falls area by far, and it is fairly priced! I always enjoy eating at the restaurant rather than getting takeout because each table gets endless green tea for free! It's my absolute favorite tea. I also love the won ton soup which is included with their combination plates and lunch specials. 
Some of my favorite entrees are the shrimp cashew, kung pao chicken, and the sweet and sour chicken, but I have never had anything there I didn't like. 
If you're new to the area, you need to check out Empress Court, and then head over to Dairy Island next door to have some ice cream after dinner!

Love this place for a quick and very affordable lunch. No frills authentic Chinese food can be found here. I have had some great soups here, sampled most of the baked goods, but my favorite is the fresh rice noodles with sliced beef and peppers. I love the wide, chewy noodles in tasty gravy, they keep me coming back. CiCi, the owner, is so nice and if you are seeking to try new new baked goods she will even throw one to try on the house. 

Also, if you are looking for a warm brothy wonton soup or congee for breakfast there is basically no other place in the area!

I come to downtown Pittsburgh annually for a convention and I eat here at least once per trip. I've ordered from the regular menu in previous years and only noticed this year that they were also having a dinner buffet. The buffet part of this restaurant is actually fairly mundane. The selection is smaller than most Chinese buffets I've been to. From the regular menu, on the other hand, the pan fried noodles are pretty decent.

There is no other place like this in Madison.  

I've been to some amazing Asian bakeries.  There's a whole slew of them in LA with lines out the door, not to mention having spent time in Taiwan where bakeries sell freshly baked custard filled breads at 33 cents.  It would be unfair to compare this place to those places.

When I say there's no other place like this in Madison, I mean that in a complimentary way because I'm so happy that such a place exists in Madison.  I love that there's a place I can order a bowl of thousand year egg congee with pork and it also comes with a bread for less than $5!  Seriously?  This place could mark up their prices by another 50%, and still retain business because they're the only place in Madison that sells Asian bakery items.  

Their breakfast combos also comes with choice of coffee or milk tea.  Since I don't drink coffee, I ordered the milk tea, which was not very good.  But I really didn't care because the combo was only $4.50 for plenty of food.  

I also got what they call "Chinese tamales," which is glutinous rice steam with peanuts and pork in a banana leaf.  It was tasty and brought back memories of what my grandma would make.  They were out of the bbq pork bun and what I call the pineapple bun when I got there at 4pm on a Sunday.  I was disappointed as those are my favorite, but the ones we did get were very good.  The buns themselves are fluffy and mildly sweet as any good Asian bun ought to be.  

Come early as they're popular enough that they run out of variety by the late afternoon.

It's your basic. The food is what's be expected of American-style Chinese food: saucy, salty, and flavorful but unoriginal.  Empress court serves crispy vegetables with watercress and sticky rice-based dishes best.  My meal was neither over nor underwhelming, but rather just as predicted.  If one is looking for standard Chinese food, Empress Court delivers, but do not expect anything out of the ordinary.
Lunch prices are too high and the portion of food is small in their lunch combos, The chinese woman who took my order was rude and nasty towards me. I will not be returning to this place ever again.

The food here is usually very good. I've been frequenting this restaurant for 12 years. They make some of the best spare ribs I've ever eaten. The Sprimp in Lobster Sauce is excellent as are most of their dishes. The Wonton Soup is disappointing. Just plain wontons, not a pork dumpling, a few shreds of roasted pork, and very few greens if any. The hot and sour is pretty good, but could be a little heartier. Their fried rice is very flavorful, some of the best I've ever eaten.. Why only three stars? The owner! Over the years, as one would expect there have been errors in the take-out. The owner will argue with you and never take responsibility or try to compensate you for the mistake. This is certainly not a good business practice. I worked in the food service industry for many years and at  every establishment, it was the policy of the owners to make a situation right by either re-making the order or compensating the customer in some way for the error or dissatisfaction.
The waiting for carry-out is getting worse. One hour for 3 star food. Overall this is below average food, but it's one of the few choices you have for Chinese food in Chagrin Falls, OH.

After years of waiting, I finally made a visit to the mysterious ASB on Park St. 

I couldn't resist trying their beef noodle soup, and that's where the mediocre rating comes from. It was a decent broth, but the noodles and veggies were generally flavorless. I haven't tried the baked goods, but I'm thinking stick to those.

This is by far my favorite Japanese restaurant in macedonia. Great service and the owners are great people. The food is delicious and my favorite is their hibachi dinners. There's great options to choose from and their sushi rolls are made fresh and decorative. Definitely a great Japanese restaurant that you must try if you're in the area!

Looooooove the beef Chang Fen (steamed crepe) here. I can eat it everyday for a month without getting fed up. As someone lived in HK for several years, I am very happy to find them serving something almost as good in Madison. Their potsticker is also quite tasty. I also recommend the egg tarts and coconut cakes.

They also serve very reasonably priced lunch specials with huge portions. The flavor isn't so bad, but as someone order take-out often, I find it a bit frustrating since the take-out portion seems to be smaller than the actual dish. Dunno if it's just me.

I also wish they had more congee choices. My favorite is preserved egg pork congee, but there is too much preserved egg in the congee, so I try to stay away from it for healthy reasons. Pork liver congee and fish congee have a taste I don't particularly enjoy.

They have limited sitting area and are very popular during lunch hours, so be prepared to wait for a seat or just order take-out like most people do.

This place is seriously really good, and I've been enjoying it recently for breakfasts, lunches, and snacks.  The prices are very affordable and the lady who womans the counter is really friendly and remembers me when I come in.  Their baked goods and buns are fun, creative, and delicious.  Their noodles, crepes, and congee are really flavorful too.  I can't remember the exact name, but one of their fish stir-fry rice entrees is incredibly flavorful also.  Yesterday I tried their milk tea for the first time and will be having that every time I'm there too:)

Absolutely AMAZING. Point blank. Great owners that are so friendly and welcoming, great sushi and you can tell it's made with care, great food from the kitchen. BEST CRAB RANGOON I HAVE EVER HAD (and that's saying a lot). Service is a little slow, simply because there is only one waitress, and she owns the place. Good food takes time. HIGHLY recommended. Small place so dont bring a big crowd, but it's such a great spot. Carry out is always spot on as well. I can't say enough good things. Check them out.
Surprisingly, this place is one of the better places to get your Chinese food fix--the american style fix that is

Relocated to Cleveland this past year and have been looking for a good sushi place not too far from Twinsburg. Eureka! The wife and I both agreed this is the spot. The chef has great attention to detail and it shows up in the flavor and presentation of what he serves. The rice is the perfect texture and flavor and they have unique roll selections. I would call the pricing reasonable compared to most sushi places in the area. They don't serve beer right now because of archaic Ohio alcohol laws (chef said he wants to get the license), but they do have wine and sake. The Sho Chiku Bai nigori sake does just fine. It's a small location so arrive early or be prepared to wait, especially now that word is getting out about this place.

Great sushi, fresh, well made and it looks amazing!

Great service, attended-to immediately and very friendly service.

The place is small, but feels really good the the service is fast.

Screw you haters. I don't know what exactly you expect from a Chinese Buffet, but this has all the essentials. 

The food was very very satisfying. From the lo mein, to the general tso's, all the way to the soups and the watermelon, everything was very very tasty.

Additionally, they have great customer service and helpful staff!!!!

The buffet was $8. It was a steal in my opinion.

Definitely going back there.
Best place to grab lunch while downtown. Great quality ingredients and wonderful service. Plus they have the best bubble tea downtown!

Ventured off the beaten path for something other than the usual breakfast fare.. definitely weren't disappointed in doing so! The small quaint shop opens at 9am but if you don't mind waiting the plethora of delicious smelling baked breads/asian pastries come piping hot out of the oven and onto the trays about 9:30am.. so we waited we dabbled into a few different options..bbq pork bun..red bean paste bun..asian tamale..coconut twist..fried donut..all this for only two mouthsbut hey..sharing is caring right!? 
Come early as we learned the locals who walk to the shop come and buy out in the blink of an eye.. who can blame them! Authentic asian pastries at phenomenal prices.. $1.00-$1.35.. the staff are extremely friendly and more than patient explaining the items and how they're made..they also offer their own personal recommendations of their faves as well.. all in all an enjoyable experience! They also offer hot soups and noodle dishes...maybe next time!
CHEERS..
Keep YELPING!

Fabulous rice rolls! Congee is slightly salty but makes our stomachs feel nice. Radish rice cake is okay. (Jasmine) milk tea reminds me of Taiwan! The price is unbelievably good (e.g. A combo is $6.50 with congee, rice roll, and milk tea).

My husband and I ordered take out for dinner one evening after long hours at work. We wanted basic chinese and that is what we got. However, we were disappointed on the spice level. We asked for medium-high spice and there was none what so ever. Other than that, it is well priced and tastes alright. It's your basic chinese food so don't expect too much but it was good service, except a long weight for takeout. We will be back and hoping to try some additional dishes with some more flavor.

I have been coming here every Monday for the last 6 months to enjoy the hot and sour soup. It is phenomenal, perhaps the finest in the Cleveland area. The staff is also incredibly helpful especially when you are torn between 2 of the many incredible dishes offered. The post modern decor is also comforting. It really feels like you are eating with the Emperor when you come to the court!

I love dropping in for a snack here when I'm driving downtown. Their rainbow roll is one of my favorites, but their moon cakes really take the cake so to speak :) I am yet to try their lunch selections but maybe one of these days!!

A friend introduced me to this place and it's phenomenal. Everyone I've interacted with here is extremely polite and the food is amazing. I can't recommend this place enough. Think of it as a pan-Asian chipotle- healthier, more flavorful and just genuinely nice people. I'd come here for lunch every single day if I could.

PROS: Authentic Chinese pastries, inexpensive, friendly staff
CONS: Small selection, limited seating

This place will satisfy your Asian pastry cravings with the standard bread with red bean paste, custard buns, egg tarts, mooncakes, etc. Nothing to write home about, but it's a solid spot for a place like Madison.

Long story short, this is a great place and filled a surprising void in downtown cle. Food is delicious and fresh so I will for sure be a frequent customer!
Long story long... I've visited several times and each time I've tried a different bowl. I honestly don't think you can go wrong with any order, especially considering how easy it is to customize. The last time I went (and here's where they lose a star), I got their "favorite" mongo tacos. When I first looked in my bag, I almost turned around, thinking they forgot to give me two tacos. They're that SMALL. I cracked open the foil to see two tortilla shells. When I finally got home with them, I was shocked! They're so tiny and not anywhere near a full meal. And considering they cost only a little less than a bowl, I thought they were overpriced. Taste was okay, they we're hot. Perhaps I just got a bad batch. The preparer literally did say "sorry I don't make the tacos often"...k. Cleveland has an amazing taco scene and if you're going to charge that much for tacos at a quick service place, they better be perfection. I would have even been a little happier if they were just stuffed with more veggies. The tacos looked nothing like the pic and were not satisfying. I'd only order again if I had some sort of coupon. 
With that being said, the tacos are my ONLY negative. Staff is super friendly. Place is super clean. Lots of seating and it's in a great location! Parking will be hit or miss if you're driving in. 
I'm glad balance is here and I hope people support this business! Also, I haven't tried their app, but they seem like they have a solid online ordering process so I'd recommend that too!

Amazing service and great food. 

The brussel sprouts are to die for. I also tried a bowl here, salad as my base, teriyaki bowl, but swapped out the teriyaki sauce for peanut sauce and a green curry, lastly my protein was steak. 

Overall it tasted good, came out quick and fresh, and was plenty of food for me to save half for lunch the next day. The peanut sauce was pretty sweet in my opinion although still good just not expected, but the green curry was deliciously spicy. I was a little disappointed by the steak as it costs extra but it was very small pieces and barely noticeable. Although, I know someone else who had steak tacos and didn't have that experience. 

I had an espresso milk tea no bubbles. It was very good but I was surprised by how sweet it was as the menu doesn't mention a sweetner for that drink.

The interior is super cute and there is plenty of room to sit. The staff is super nice, friendly, and helpful.

Moved to area over a year ago and was pretty bummed to have to drive a ways in any direction to find decent sushi. Just decent. No more! Ordered a sushi dinner to go here, and it was AMAZING. Huge pieces of fish for the sushi, great service, so excited to have found them!!

I came here with my parents for lunch (they are super picky about Chinese food) and we all enjoyed everything we ordered (esp the mini moon cake and dumplings). Super authentic, and the service was friendly and brisk. Will definitely come back!

Like you, I saw amazing reviews so I gave it a try. So glad I did! Parking can be tight in strip mall lot and size of restaurant is small but the sushi is amazing! And really, all you should care about is great sushi. Lovely staff took great care of me and I enjoyed two unique rolls. Lots of things I'd never seen before - can't wait to go back!

I love these guys. The owners run the food and the floor. They are extremely nice, remembered my name, and make the most incredible sushi. I told them to keep it small and keep doing what they're doing. You may have to wait a moment to get your food but it is highly worth the wait. I travel for work and always try the local sushi. This is the best I've had. Try the Beauty and the Beast. This is my new found Love. If you're searching for another, try land & sea, but the Beauty and the beast is just.. so... perfect.. in every way! Gosh I love you guys. I'll be back to Cleveland if only for this.

I love this place. The baked goods are awesome, not-too-sweet Asian bakery classics with some savory options too. My husband especially loves anything with the sweet top. Taro Twists are probably my favorite. Egg Custard Buns and Tarts are also amazing. It's hard to pick, so usually we get a huge box with a mix of things.

Everything we've tried has been good, and the prices are great! $1-2 for all the baked goods, which are giant. We also finally ate lunch, which was also really good. Again, the prices were very reasonable. We shared two small items and two entrees, bringing half of one home, and it was about $25.

Every time I've gone, the same woman has helped us. She is very friendly and willing to describe items we aren't familiar with and give opinions, which I really appreciate.

Definitely give this place a try if you haven't already!
The food is very good and price is not expensive. The sushi is fresh and taste delicious. I also ordered hibachi and the steak is great.

This place is AWESOME!!!!!  The food is excellent, reasonable and best of all the owners are really cool people.  I don't often leave a review, but these guys deserve this...    You don't need me to tell you this...  they will be very successful on their own.   See for yourself and check them out!!  YUM-MY!!!!!
Excellent atmosphere and food. We went for our first time a few weeks ago and plan on returning. A family owned business.

My favorite Chinese place in the area. You can always count on them for easy, delicious take out. If you choose to dine inside the atmosphere is quaint and seemingly authentic and never too busy. Service is always prompt and very efficient.  The egg rolls and wonton soup are both always crowd pleasers and their menu is extensive, so you'll surely find something to satisfy all member of your family or group of friends!

I was walking by and the sweet smell of "Chinese" food captured me. I went for the buffet because I was pretty hungry. Now, for a fair warning, this is not real Chinese food because nearly everything was deep-fried candy General Tso's and imitation crab ragoons. I knew what to expect, that is why I am giving this place three stars. You know when sometimes for breakfast you get the itch to go order a bunch of donuts even though you should be eating 2 slices of 100% whole wheat bread? It was kind of like that since I hadn't eaten this kind of crap in a while. It fulfilled the indulgence. So, pretty much what I saw were all the American classics like General Tso's chicken, Sweet and Sour pork, beef and broccoli, and some others with some steamed and fried rice. Most of it tasted pretty horrible, as was to be expected, but I rather enjoyed the General Tso's chicken and the fried rice.

It's not the classiest of joints, but what can you really expect for $7.50? The waitress gave pretty good service (she seemed sweet too)

*They accept all credit cards*

Food Quality/Taste = 1 Stars (Chinese food) / 3 Stars (American Food)
Portion Size Given Price = 5 Stars
Price = 4 Stars
Service = 4 Stars
Experience with Staff = 4 Stars
Decor = 2 Stars

We stopped in for lunch today and the food was excellent. We started with black pepper tuna appetizer and edamame. The tuna was my favorite part of the entire meal. It was so good. My wife does not like sushi or fish in general. She always gets a sweet potato roll. I always seem to eat half of hers and we have to order a second. Now, I just order one with every meal. Man, was that roll good at Zuki's. For my second roll I got the foreplay roll. I must not have read the entire description because this was baked!! none the less it was very good, I am just not accustom to eating warm sushi unless it is tempura. Today I got to try something new (at least for me) and it was very good.
Love the service and excellent food!! Always fresh and friendly people. Have gone several times my kids also love it!

After eating at almost every sushi spot in Cleveland, it is awesome to have one that is local to me. The chef started out in New Orleans and has been making sushi for ten years. He really does an excellent job with the rice, which, believe it or not, is the true backbone to good sushi. It is not too sweet or too sour and is cooked with just the right amount of "bite" so that you can actually taste the texture of the grains. They use high quality rice.  

Was pressed for time so had take out. Regular sushi dinner and chicken pad thai along with a rainbow roll. All the sushi was spot on. As I watched the chef, we chatted, and I could tell he was not only skilled, but paid attention to detail in forming the rice and placing the fish. The rice to fish ratio was ideal in the rolls and the sushi. Nothing worse than getting a big honking mound of rice with a tiny piece of fish. The sushi dinner came with miso soup or clear soup (mushrooms and fried onions) and salad. I had the miso. Nicely done. Not too salty. The salad was iceberg (fresh and crispy), but the standard dressing was really good. Nicely in balance. Not sure if they offer a japanese salad. The pad thai was very good. Not drowning in sauce or with a funky color that can just ruin it. Nice balance of fish sauce, sweetness and citrus. Rice noodles where not overcooked and still had some texture too them even though I did not eat until I got home. All the takeout packaging was secure and neatly packaged. Noticed that the menu had hibachi (cooked in the kitchen, not table top), based on my experience with the pad thai, I would try it next time. 

The place is small (six or seven tables? and a small sushi bar, five or six seats?) but nicely decorated and clean. The staff really went out of their way to make me comfortable, answer my questions and point out unique items based on my preferences. All despite the fact that I was just getting take out. And the best part, highly reasonable prices for the quality. The menu is not overwhelming, but they do have a unique selection of rolls and a fair amount of hot food. I would have to assume that if business booms the sushi offerings would expand (they do have almost all the standards plus a few more options for the adventurous). If I could critique one thing, it would be the wasabi. Feel like it could have been firmer and hotter. It was serviceable though. Pickled ginger was pink, not yellow. Standard, but not amazing. I prefer the yellow. 

My take away, Zuki is legit. If my subsequent experiences are as good as my initial one, I will be a regular. I was hesitant to write this review because this place appears to be a hidden gem and it is small. I want to keep it all to myself (and just roll in on a Friday night and actually get a seat), but the food was just too good not to give them the props they deserve. On a price to quality ratio, this place is off the chart.
Awesome food! Monster roll is one of my new favorites in addition to the General Tso chicken. Recommend to everyone

Balance is a spacious and bright new lunch spot in downtown Cleveland. 

The ordering style is build your own bowl. You pick a pre-designed bed of veg, add a protein and a base. The cashier was really helpful in helping me choose. 

I ordered the Wiseman Bowl which contained broccoli, carrots, corn, sprouts, and kale. It came with Szechuan Sauce - served on the side which I liked because I only used about 1/5th of the sauce I was given. 

I'll definitely be back for a fast and healthy big portioned lunch.

Great food comes in small spaces. The food is fresh and tasty. We had the Love Boat for 2. It was just the right amount of food.  While we were there, we saw half a dozen to go orders, carefully packed.  I heard at least four languages besides English so the menu appeals to many. We will definitely return. I do suggest a reservation. With only 22 seats plus 6 at the sushi bar, it can get crowded in a hurry.

My friends and I went here for the buffet during a convention held in late June.  The buffet was honestly pretty terrible.  It was some of the worst Cantonese food I've had, but perhaps I've been spoiled by the offerings in Los Angeles county.

The food was overcooked and just appeared to be sitting out there.  It was bland and uninspiring, and much of it was way too oily.  I felt fairly sick after eating there, but the excitement of the con kept me from noticing, really.

I was pretty excited to learn that there's an Asian bakery right outside of downtown Madison (at the intersection of Park and Fish Hatch) so I went to check it out as soon as I could. There's a decent selection here, although it's not as much as you would be used to seeing if you went to a bakery in a Chinatown. You can also sit down (it has a small amount of seating, maybe 10 people in total...?) and eat, which was kind of strange to me, but probably more ordinary to people who haven't been around Chinese bakeries before.

I enjoyed all the food I bought here, but I will say that I would highly suggest eating the food the same day you buy it. If you let it sit for even a day or so, I think it tastes a lot more stale (which is not the bakery's fault in any way).

I really liked this place so check it out if you've been looking for some Chinese bakery food!

I have been here 2 times and both times the sushi has been very very good. I also tried their orange chicken lunch special that was flavorful and served with rice. 

The menu consists of appetizers, sushi, entrees, hibachi and they have lunch specials. The hibachi I have not tried and is not cooked in front of you which can be a plus so you don't leave smelling like it.

The place is small and if going at dinner time expect to wait but it is definitely worth the wait.
I know, I know sushi from a resturaunt in a plaza? The answer is Yes! You will not be disappointed. Or don't go that's okay more for me. (Insert emoji with tounge sticking out and silverware in hand)

Wow, this is located in an unassuming white, nondescript plaza on the side of the road in Macedonia. If I didn't find it on Yelp, I wouldn't have even thought to try it, but I'm really glad I stopped in! 

Stopped in for lunch on a Friday and it was pretty busy and the poor waitress was alone, working her butt off inside and takeout orders. While it's pretty small inside, I was really impressed with her work ethic and providing good service even though she was slammed. 

This place is insanely cost effective, especially if you go at lunch! For 5 people to eat, we spent $60, getting a sushi roll to start, everyone getting a meal, and two desserts to finish! 

We got a spider sushi roll for $10 and it was delicious! Crab, avocado, cucumber, rolled to perfection. I got the chicken teriyaki bento box that came with a lot of food for the price! It was around ~$8 for the box and came with chicken, rice, soup, 3 California rolls, and 3 little fried dumplings. Too much food to eat in one sitting, but it was so good that I did anyway. 

We finished with green tea ice cream, with a little whipped cream and chocolate on top in a cute little sundae cup. 

All in all, I would say it was definitely worthwhile to stop in and I can't wait to go back and try more sushi!

This hidden gem doesn't look like much from the outside, but it's one of the best sushi restaurants I have ever been to (and I know good sushi! )! The crab Rangoon started the meal off on a tasty note.  We enjoyed the rainbow and Hawaiian rolls.  Both were delicious! The only downside is it's a smaller restaurant, so there may be a wait but it's TOTALLY worth it! Great date spot. Not great for larger groups. My boyfriend and I will be coming back soon!
I didn't think any place could top Toko but this exceeded expectations!   So good, nice place, Nice owners.  This will be a frequent place for us.

I have been waiting in anticipation for this restaurant to open. I had hear about them when they stopped by my office with free bubble tea for us to try and told us about how they had plans to open downtown. They are originally from Toledo and were looking to expand into other areas. So as I stalked them on Instagram I noticed that they were giving away tickets to try their food out and hang out with King Chip, a local cleveland rapper. I jumped at the chance to win some tickets and luckily I did and my boyfriend and I headed over on a rainy Saturday. Just an FYI they are open for lunch Monday-Friday and will hope to officially open full time after Thanksgiving.

Onto the food!!!!! I ordered a Wiseman bowl that came with wheat noodles, kale, corn, steak, bean sprouts, and a few other veggies and schezuan sauce on the side. You can customize your bowl however you would like and its similar to Chipotle where you pick your carb and protein. It was very tasty and I really liked that they heated the sauce on the side so your not putting a cold sauce on warm noodles. Oh and the steak? AMAZING!!! This is no cheap steak folks. This is quality steak they put in their bowls. My boyfriend ordered the south by southeast tacos and just a warning they are pretty spicy. Still delicious however but if you like heat this is the taco to get. They come with cilantro and some pickled red onion to cool things down a bit. And of course no meal would be complete without bubble tea. They have many varieties here but I recommend you try the strawberry mojito first. It tastes very fresh and not like sugary processed juice. 
 
If you're looking for a new spot to grab a nice healthy lunch that won't break the bank then stop by. You won't be dissapointed.

This review is (mostly) not for their sweet, but for they savory. We stopped by here for dinner one evening and while the bakery shelf looked nice but a little sparse (presumably since it was near the end of the day), what we were really impressed with was their food menu. 

The menu lists soup and lunch specials, but they are really served all day. There are real Chinese dishes here, such as Bitter Melon with Beef, and Congee with Pork Liver + Preserved Egg. We got the Bitter Melon, in a pleasantly salty black bean sauce which was nice and tender although the beef was nothing special, and the Beef Tendon Noodle Soup with the wide fresh handmade noodles. They weren't kidding -- the noodles were very wide, very fresh, and very handmade. They do the same thing spaghetti does when you pick it up, except that it's much bigger and made out of rice. Good tendon too.

This is about a 3.5, but since the prices are so good (that big bowl of noodle soup was only 7.00), I'm rounding it up to 4. 

Also of note: the mooncakes, when available, are good (especially the one with egg), although a little pricy.

Great food comes in small spaces. The food is fresh and tasty. We had the Love Boat for 2. It was just the right amount of food.  While we were there, we saw half a dozen to go orders, carefully packed.  I heard at least four languages besides English so the menu appeals to many. We will definitely return. I do suggest a reservation. With only 22 seats plus 6 at the sushi bar, it can get crowded in a hurry.

This is the best Sushi Restaurant I have been to since Virginia Beach.  So so good. We are going almost every week!  So happy they were open Christmas Eve!  The Christmas Sushi Roll was delicious!  Very small place but so good.

The food is disgusting and the service is the same. There was something floating in my glass of wine. The shrimp in my entree had a foul smell. I didn't eat it because I was afraid of contracting food poisoning. In addition, the bathrooms are filthy. Hunan by the Falls blows this place away! Do NOT eat here!

I haven't tried any of the entrees here because I can't get passed the bakery case every time I come in. Everything is sooo good and the young men who usually work up front are cute and friendly. 

Dining area is limited, so I always get my bakery goodies to go, and then I hoard them in my car. The parking lot layout is tiny and bizarre, so I bypass it completely and park down a residential street on the side.

If you see some weirdo lady in a car hoarding baked goods nearby, don't worry, it's just me having a good time.

The sushi rolls were delicious and the price was just right. My husband and I are so glad we found our sushi place that doesn't overcharge for their rolls like most of the places around here. And the servings are huge and did I mention that they were delicious?

This is my favorite sushi place. Yummy sushi at a reasonable price.  Great service. We have been here a couple of times and have had a good experience every time. I highly recommend coming here if you are close by.
Open all the time. Good Chinese for what it is. Could be cheaper but it's reasonable.

It was very good here. We were able to park in the back.  I ordered an edamame to start I wanted a boat or bridge.... he didn't wah wah wah. So we got two Bento boxes chicken teriyaki. I looked at the dinner one and when the lunch one came... disappointed. But that's our fault I guess but she didn't ask either. Those came with miso.   Wanting a bit more sushi I ordered an eel maki. Of course we shared. But I'm a bit wanting yet on the sushi... oh well next time. I also didn't get any pix !! Cause we were hungry.

I didn't think any place could top Toko but this exceeded expectations!   So good, nice place, Nice owners.  This will be a frequent place for us.  
Update 1/6/18....back again. This pic doesn't do this presentation justice.  AMAZING and SO GOOD!!

My mom and I come to this little sushi house as often as we can! If you're looking for authentic sushi at a fair price, this is the place to go! Excited to have such a delicious option for sushi in a small town such as Macedonia.

An interesting concept as well as an exciting new eatery in downtown CLE. This is fast casual Asian food following a similar model as Chipotle where food is made upon order and everything is customized. The menu has a lot of variety pulling from Chinese, Thai, and Indian influences. The food is fresh and the dining area spotless complete with cell phone charging at the high top tables. I'll be back again and again!!!

I learned of the restaurant through the benefit of a wonderful Yelp event. Before I get into the food. I have to start with the bubble tea. It was delicious. I know some are on the bubble about it, but theirs will change your mind. They have milk, coffee, and fruit based bubble tea. The strawberry is a winner and great for first timers. Being a new facility, of course they are clean. What's even better is that they care about the environment. The containers, drinkware, etc. are either biodegradable, reusable or recyclable. 

Yummy, Yummy!!

Snacks: There is an assortment of snacks. Edamame, beets, wontons, sweet potato salad, nachos, and many more. I would like to introduce you to the best potato salad you haven't tried yet. Sweet Potatoes!! OMG! This salad is both sweet and savory. Bye bye mayonnaise and vinegar dressings, this one is out of this world. It was described by the cashier as being a magical experience. He was right. Every bite was delightful. 

Crispy cream cheese wontons. Excuse me, crispy warm cream cheese wontons. Nothing to explain here. It's a must. The fact that they are warm should make you drive here immediately. I cannot tell you the number of times I have ordered them throughout the city and they are cold. 

You are probably hungry and want to know what the main course is. Tacos and Bowls! Don't frown, they are delicious. You can either choose from their pre-designed bowls or build your own. The vegetables are fresh. I mean, no pesticide taste, no label stickers, no vegetable weirdness. I overheard one of staff members say they would like to start farming their vegetables nearby the Cleveland location. I believe there is a central farm for the Toledo locations. I ordered a steak teriyaki bowl with brown rice. I'm boring. I know. My bowl was anything but boring. The flavors danced in my mouth. I ate half for dinner and the other half for lunch the next day. Balance is nice enough to give you their sauce on the side. You have the power to add as much or little as you like. 

My only dislike is that there is not a fish option. I was truly hoping for one. Otherwise, play around with the bowl and taco choices. Enjoy a tasty meal!

Inexpensive, asian bakery items. I thought all of the sweet bakery items had a similar taste - not that I'm complaining! You can definitely tell they make these sweets from scratch and with love. I may or may not have made myself sick from eating too many different kinds of goods...

When you're looking for a quick and easy meal to grab on the go, fast food is the popular choice. With a wide range of options, this food is convenient, inexpensive, and tastes good. But fast also means high sodium, trans fat, and cholesterol. Sure, you can customize your order to be healthier; order grilled chicken, skip the bun, and avoid creamy sauces. But all the added sugar and empty calories won't fill you up. With so many fast food chains around the city, it becomes tough to maintain healthy eating habits. Not to worry! Healthy fast food does exist. Next time you need to eat on the run, find yourself a dish at Balance Grille where they serve real food, fast loaded with simple, colorful fresh cut, whole ingredients that are prepared daily. Taste the creative flavors of their mongo tacos, or their Asian-fusion build-a-bowls. Add vegetables, swap sauces, or go for the classic teriyaki like I did. This takeout isn't fried or processed. The food is always fresh, so dig in without a forkful of guilt. If you haven't been to Balance Grille, you're missing out! Whether you work in the city, or just passing by, pop in and give it a try, and let me know what you think. Sincerelybs.com

This place is awesome! Great food and great service! We had the tempura and shumai appetizers and a variety of nigiri and sushi rolls. All delicious and very fresh! One of us tried the chicken hibachi--very generous portions and very tasty. Our server and chef were friendly and attentive. From the food, to the service, to how they plate the food, you can tell they care about their customers. So happy to have a great sushi place in Macedonia now. Will definitely be back!

One of my favorite bakeries!  I love the tiny space - makes it feel warm and comfy.  The baked goods are amazing.  The food items from the menu are better than most local Asian restaurants at decent prices. 

The mango sponge cake slices are delicious! 

A must try if you have never had Asian baked goods or want to try some food that's on the same level as home cooked meals. Come around 10:30-11am when the taro bread is fresh out of the oven.

Loved balance when I was in college at bowling green so I was extremely excited when I heard there was a new one in Cleveland. It is beautiful inside and everyone was so nice ! Food of course is amazing. My favorites are the creamy wontons, Brussels sprouts, and the wiseman bowl. Great vegetation options as well. Wish parking was easier so I could just stop by but that's downtown living. They also did a giveaway on their Instagram and gave out a ton of gift cards. They know what they're doing !!

This is review is based solely on my experiences and observations from my last visit (2nd visit). Just stopped in for a take out order and was greeted by three friendly staff, one wearing shiny cat ears. I ordered the bang bang chicken tacos, a budda bowl with steak and fried rice, the beet snack, and a purple taro milk. Two staff commented how much they loved the purple taro milk and so did I. I chose almond milk and tapioca bubbles, I only wish I had ordered the large. I never thought I'd write a review for milk, a five star one at that. I had to save some to share with my wife but forgot to tell her about the bubbles, so that was a bit of a shock, sorry hon. So many different varieties of bubble teas I want to try. The budda bowl was delicious and fresh, the sauce was a curry that had a heat that creeps up on you after the initial savory taste. The bang bang taco corn tortilla didn't stand up well to the travel home and would have been better in store nothing remarkable here. But the bang bang sauce was just ok, kind of sweet and tangy. Most surprised that I liked the beets, because I don't like beets, I mean I really don't like beets. But my wife didn't care for them so I tried them and they tasted like they were pickled and a bit minty. Is this swiss chard in here? I'm eating it now. If this were closer to my home or I worked downtown I'd walk here for fast healthy lunch. Variety of proteins makes it very vegan friendly. If you're already downtown check it out but for me to go downtown and park in a garage to primarily go here, probably not gonna happen. Location is immaculately clean and well run by folks who obviously care about their finished product.

Balance is a great healthy option in a sea of bars and processed foods downtown! Treat your body to something healthy and delicious at Balance. Their full bowl portion is enough for two meals, especially if you get a snack. Their snack menu is great for smaller portion meals. And you can order online!

This was probably one of the best sushi places I've been to. It's a small restaurant, but the quality is impeccable. I had the spicy kani roll while the friends I was with had the bridge. The setup of the bridge was adorable! Service was great, and the sushi rolls were delicious. I'd highly recommend trying the spicy kani or spicy tuna rolls, as those were our favorite. Definitely worth a stop!

Wow is all I can say! The buffet was very limited and seemed empty for most of the part. In addition, the food was luke warm/cold. The hot and sour soup I thought would be good but was watered down, and lacked flavor. The waitress was kind though and provided us drinks and cleared our table in a timely manner. Just wish the experience was better. I guess if you eat cheap food you get cheap quality food!

My mom and I visited Balance Pan-Asian Grille on a Monday night.  As soon as we walked the staff greeted us and the space had a very open and clean ambiance.  The menu is vegan-friendly and has something for everyone! The bubble tea was delicious and the food was very tasty and fresh!!! We customized our own bowls! As we were eating, a staff member came over to check in and make sure everything was great! I will definitely go back to Balance Pan-Asian the next time I'm in Cleveland!
The worst....if u like super salty wonton soup, all salt pepper steak you will love this place. I felt my arteries hardening. Not kidding.

I went to get a box full of steam buns. She asked if I could wait five minutes (but really around 15 minutes) for a fresh batch. The pork and vegetable steam buns are a favorite and worth the wait. Some days, they'll run out of the steam buns, but if you can check back in an hour or so, things get replenished.

Avoid, avoid, avoid.  These people seem to have a thing for bringing their kids into work, and one of the little bastards tried to drop kick me as I walked in the door. I should've left then. The place was filthy; they must have friends in high places that keep them from being shut down. I was in a big hurry because I was on a break from work, so I took a chance and ordered chicken lo mein. It was edible. The young guy working behind the counter was very polite, but that doesn't make up for the filth, and the attempted drop kick. Try Springgarden or King Fong instead.

As a disclaimer, I would have given this place 5 stars if I had not recently come back from a trip to LA where these bakeries are a dime a dozen.  Needless to say, I was extremely excited to see that this bakery had opened and was very happy with the results.  We had cha siu bao, which was very good.  The bun was spot on in my opinion, and the filing was almost right.  We also had both types of custard buns, the smooth one and the crusty one, which were also very tasty.  In addition, I had the wonton noodle soup, which was pretty good.  The broth needed a little more flavor, but the wontons themselves were nice and had a good shrimpy flavor to them.  My husband had the porkchop in pepper sauce, which was a little different from the usual dish you would find ina hongkong cafe, but the sauce was good.
All in all, this place is not the best I've ever been to but it is comparable to the asian bakeries you would find in LA.  It really does fill a void when you are feeling homesick :)

Yay!  An additional healthy option in downtown Cleveland.  I was super impressed with my experience at Balance Pan-Asian Grille.  A co-worker had visited when the restaurant first opened, and raved about the menu.  I finally had an opportunity to visit, and I was not at all disappointed.  I ordered the Wise Guy, over brown rice, with chicken.  My entree was fresh, plentiful and satisfying.  The veggies, were cooked perfectly and the portion was more than generous for the price point of approx $8+.  The staff was super helpful.  I will absolutely add this place to my rotation of lunch options.

Love the fast casual but healthy vibe they have.  I always stick with the bowls - I've tried a bunch of different ones and they're all excellent.  Works good as a lunch or dinner honestly.

Also the staff is very friendly and helpful. I had an error on an order once and they went out of their way to make it right and give me a gift card for it even though it wasn't a big deal.  

I'm lucky to have a place like Balance in close proximity to where I live.  Highly recommend!

Hidden gem in a nondescript plaza. The service is great, and the sushi is fresh and fantastic! I have visited three times, and can attest to its consistency in quality. Parking is tight, but there is more available behind the plaza. Enjoy!

This place has a fantastic staff and food. Great place! The food is fresh and the environment is quiet. Get the crab Rangoon it's homemade and a staple here. Tried various rolls and never had a bad one!

Wow.  Wow.  Wow.  This place is SO Good!  Located in an area of Cleveland that's currently (and has been for awhile) under construction, please don't let that deter you.  Balance has a very fresh, clean, and modern vibe.  The staff are fantastic and are quick to guide you through a thoroughly customizable menu that can work for most anyone!  There are several suggested options, but the sky's the limit.  

You start out by first picking a vegetable option, then protein, carbs or salad, and a sauce.  I got the Wiseman, which was broccoli, carrots, bean shoots, and corn.  I paired it with chicken, brown rice, and the Thai Guy sauce because I'm a sucker for peanut sauce.  All of the sauce is served on the side, which is great so you can add as little or as much as you'd like.

Once I got it back to my hotel and started to chow down, I realized this wouldn't be my last trip back - it's that awesome!  Check them out!

Just discovered this place last week and I've already been there twice.  The bakery is fresh, with flaky pastry and delicious fillings.  Try the lotus bean bun, you won't be disappointed.  Their lunch menu is served through closing and you can eat in or take out.  The salt and pepper shrimp was amazing - big juicy shrimp, peppers and onions, perfectly seasoned.  While it was empty on my first visit, the place was packed tonight - with people waiting for one of the four tables to open up.  Go here.  Now.
Unreal place. Food was delicious. The owners are great people. Highly recommend going here! The sushi was the best I've ever had !

The food here is fresh, delicious and a wonderful change to Pan-Asian choices in the area. All fresh ingredients and the bubble tea is the best I've had anywhere!!! Highly recommend Balance Pan-Asian Grille!

I have eaten here a few times now and tried something different every time.  I know chicken teriyaki seems boring but it might be my favorite item.  I tried the bang bang chicken tacos and they were really good.  My husband was jealous he didn't get them and I am usually a baby when it comes to spice but I couldn't stop eating them even though my mouth was on fire.  The staff is very friendly every time I go, I love the atmosphere because it feels so clean and modern.  It's fun exploring their menu and I have tried bubble tea for the first time.  It was good, not too sweet!  The portions are pretty big so be prepared for leftovers.
What a treat!!! So impressed with this new little spot. Wonderful presentation. Delicious sushi. Such nice friendly husband/wife owners. Will be back!
The food at Empress Court is always good. They may be a little understaffed at times and you will have to wait a long time....But in the end the price and quality make up for the wait.

I've been looking for a good sushi place since I first moved to Cleveland.  I've tried probably 5-6 different places, lots of expensive places with decent sushi but nothing great.  Zuki is definitely what I was looking for.  Consistently great sushi, good size, lots of choices and at a very fair price.  Glad I finally found a place like this.

How lucky! A fantastic, fresh and fast sushi restaurant, not even 5 minutes away from home! We placed a take-away order of salads, soup, tempura vegetables and desert (tempura cheesecake), and it was all delicious! I'd recommend this best-kept secret to anyone!

This place always looked busy so we tried it and it was a good choice. The food was excellent and the service too. Very friendly and clean. I would recommend this place. It's not just sushi there. They had other items too.  Even hibachi too.  Good place.

Balance is amazing and I can't say enough good things about them. The food is fresh, clean, and so gosh darn delicious. Do yourself a favor and check it out soon!  (I'm hooked, so you'll probably see me there)

You can select from appetizers (Snacks), bowls, or tacos. The bowls and tacos give you options on the general flavor theme, along with protein (chicken, steak, tofu...) and starch options (noodles, rice, greens...)  The tacos also give shell options. I have yet to find anything I don't like, so you really can't  go wrong. They also have a vast array of tea flavors and options such as bubble tea, milk tea, and iced tea. I also saw some natural sugar soda bottles. 

I went with the taco sampler for $10 and was blown away. See my choices in the pics below. Really good stuff here.

Great General Tsao's chicken.  I eat here at least once every couple of months.  Workers are very nice though at times service can be a little slow.  I probably have had everything on the menu and it's all very good. If you order something extra spicier , make sure you let them know what level heat you want it a at!

I can't believe this is the first time I found this place after being here for almost a year. The food here is authentic and reminds me of all the ethnic food I've been missing. Their prices are extremely reasonable.

I know a lot of people come here solely for the pastries but don't gloss over their lunch food as well. Their thousand egg congee is really great! I also had their beef noodle dish which left me wanting more. I'm definitely going to be coming back here much more to get pastries as well as for a quick bite. I forgot to mention the crepes as well. Just all around really great chinese food!

I'm so happy Madison has a place like that.

This was my first time here and I had a wonderful first impression. Even during the lunch time rush, the staff was friendly and welcoming. When the line got backed up, someone came to pass out menus so that everyone would have a chance to prepare before reaching the counter. 

I selected a bowl with carrots, broccoli and sprouts. I chose chicken as my protein and rice as my foundation. It was crowded, but it took less than 10 minutes for my order. I like that there is a table with phone chargers right in front of the window where you watch your food being prepared. The food was delicious! The sauce was awesome and the portion was well worth the cost. 

The dining area feels airy and simple. It's light and a nice place to step away from the hustle of the office.
Good food, but the wait for take-out is loooooong. I would eat hear again. Remember a 20min wait means 40min

Brought my sister and my son here to try the sweets they have. We were excited to see all the goodies , I think we got almost one of everything !? Next time we'll go for lunch. I'm also recommending the Oriental Shop a couple doors down, they are just as cute!!

Very unassuming restaurant, but the food is delicious.  Sushi is excellent and the bento boxes are delicious as well.  My only complaint is that the hot tea has a strange plastic taste.  Overall, a solid Japanese restaurant.

This place is amazing! Great service And the sushi is hands down the best I've had!!! Every roll I've had I'd fantastic! Stop buying sushi at giant eagle people! This is the place to go! Only thing it's a lil small but u can always call in and get it Togo!! Come all sushi lover!! Love it love it love it!
Been here twice now. What a great find. This is great sushi with fresh fish and some great specialty rolls. My go to spot now
Asian take on the classic Moe's/Chipotle/Qdoba style assembly line restaurant.  Fresh ingredients and their sauces are bomb. Highly recommend giving it a try

More than just a bakery, Asian Sweet Market is also an authentic Cantonese dishes featuring wallet-friendly prices in a no frills setting (the food is served on paper plates with plastic utensils). Service could also be described as no frills - my interactions with staff could best be described as transactions.  The beef with udon noodles is excellent, the lighted seared beef packed plenty of flavor and the vegetables were perfectly prepared.  There are only a handful of tables and very limited parking.  No WiFi.

My second visit was much better then the first, in my opinion the chicken is waaaaay better then the steak. I got the sauce on the side but also thought the garlic sauce was better then the teriyaki.  I love cucumbers and lunch places don't always have these many veggies so when I want a healthier lunch option this a go to spot. I was pleasantly surprised by the chips and salsa too, more of a fried pita and roasted tomato.

Oryza Asian grill is the newest fast casual eatery to hit Settler's Ridge. This area is long in need of descent restaurants finally has come up with a winner.

Their focus is on health based dining using sustainable foods put in compostable bowls. Like most chains of this type you start in a line, order your basic which is a bowl, wrap, or salad and work your way from there. You have a choice of white rice, red rice, or white noodles. You then pick your protein which includes tofu if you are vegan. You are allowed 3 vegetables including organic egg for your bowl for free, any additional you pay a slight upcharge. You then can choose a sauce, toppings, fixings and and misc things you wish to garnish it with.

You can then purchase bottled beverages from their refrigerator or you can purchase a drink from the soda fountain where you serve yourself. For dessert you can buy a caramel yum tart or get a box of chips. The prices here are very reasonable.

For my selection I made a salad bowl, topped with chicken, green beans, sauteed vegetables and spicy sesame sauce. For my toppings I added garlic pieces as well as roasted carrots.

You can then either take it out or eat inside a beautiful clean dining area furnished with white booths to sit in. I saw a sign outside that says they now do catering. Outdoor seating is also available. There are also a few TVs inside if you care to see what's on. They also participate in door dash.

This salad was delicious and extremely filling! As a matter of fact they give you so much of it that sometimes you end up having to take it home. One of the staff came over to see how I was doing and I gave him a thumbs up. When I inquired about the soft drinks I learned at this point they don't brew their own ice tea nor sell premade ones. They did have a delicious pomegranate flavored water which I found very enjoyable.

If you go for just the basics then with tax you are probably looking at a little over $10.00 for your bowl. The location is great for movie lovers since it sits to the left of Cinemark in Robinson. It also sits away from Settler's Ridge Giant Eagle Marketplace so you aren't swept away by those shoppers.

This is a welcome addition to Settler's Ridge and gives you an opportunity to enjoy a very filling meal at a very reasonable price.

Super helpful staff, was my first time to the Balance Pan-Asian Grille but I've been to other places with a similar business model. Their menu is simple and easy to navigate, you pick a base for your bowl then choose the protein and sauce. They also have bubble tea which is a weakness of mine and it was very tasty. The sauces were on point and they give you more than enough for the serving size that you get in a bowl. Their service is quite quick and easy for a 30 minute lunch break for anyone working in the area. Also they do have a bin for compost separate from trash and recycling which I respect.

This place is what happens when a Hibachi place and Chipotle have a love child!  They have a ton of different flavors of yum yum sauce and the food is pretty good, I can see this place being around for a while. I'd rate them higher but they need a little bit more variety of toppings, but other than that, it's a solid joint.
I stopped in for a quick lunch and this place is highkey Fire! Great portions for the price and the customer service was awesome! If you are looking for a quick healthier option I would suggest it.

I normally do not write bad reviews, but am motivated by the obviously fake reviews here that are glowing, and from out of town accounts with one review.
The place is a disorganized mess. Not very busy but everything slow slow and chaotic. The only staff were a few young people, likely the owner's kids, who appear to have never before worked in a restaurant. Maybe never been in a restaurant. The food was bland and generic, think low end food court; there might not be a "chef" other than a microwave and can opener. One of us got sushi, and to address the fake reviews- it was not actually sushi but was made with some sort of fish paste.  I really wanted to have good asian in Shadyside, this isn't it

Definitely worth it to come eat here. The food is amazing and the presentation is beyond great! They make it into a work of art. They're very friendly and welcoming. The lemon salmon is DELICIOUS! I highly recommend you try it.

Finally walked to 20 feet to try Balance Pan-Asian Grille. What made me finally make that move? I found out they have bubble tea!! Soooo many bubble tea options and pretty affordable for bubble tea! I high recommend it! I try the Just Peachy w/ Passion fruit bubbles! So great! 
My friend tried the Wiseman Bowl and said it was good and healthy and she felt full but not stuffed after eating it, which is PERFECT for a work day lunch! 
I foolishly wanted to try 3 different tacos so I tried the taco trio and I am however pretty stuffed. But its such a great deal, $10 for 3 tacos!
 The bang bang taco had tons of flavor BUT the bang bang sauce is way spicier than the bang bang sauce you find at Harry Buffalo or City Tap. It's a whole new level. My mouth and throat were on fire for a solid 3 mins before I found something to counter act it (a donut hole) in the company kitchen. 
The soho taco was good but probably the most bland of the tacos I tried, not quick my favorite. 
I really enjoyed the flavors of the mongo taco! 
I definitely need to explore more on their menu but I would consider this a successful first visit.

We tried someplace new - well new to us - (we used to come here when it was Qdobas) - tonight.   Oryza is located in Settlers Ridge next to the cinema- so parking is tight on busy movie nights.  

We walked in - very clean... check box number one.  We ventured to the front and admitted it was our first time there and the lady who helped us explained everything to us - included what red rice was and how it differs from regular rice ( tastes similar but more nutrients).  Check box number two - friendly and helpful staff.  

I did the bowl with teriyaki chicken and had green beans / steamed veggies and broccoli and mushrooms added - got to sauces and she recommended the teriyaki and garlic yum (even let me sample) and ... sold!   You can add carrots , cucumbers and onions at no charge but if you want the guacamole there is an extra charge.  I added garlic chips and sesame seeds as well.  Figured we would try the chips and salsa since we were there :)  

All in all - the food was tasty. I think I will pass on the garlic chips next time - little to overpowering for me.  The chips were good as well - I personally was not a fan of the salsa but the rest of my group like it .. check box three. 

While we were there. - two separate people came around to check to make sure we were ok ... keep the up ... no matter how busy you get - means a lot even if you don't need anything....check box four.

Nice newer place to try if your shopping or looking for a quick bite before heading to movies.

I came to know about Balance Pan-Asian Grille through Yelp. I tried Thai Guy rice bowl and it's so delicious. It's a 15-min walk from my office but since the food is good and we can order ahead through their app, it's worth it!

This is a really good place!  There aren't many great eating options in Macedonia.  Mostly you have chain/franchise choices.  This place produces very tasty sushi at reasonable prices.  I will be back!

I will now refer to this as Asian Chipotle.  It's quick and tasty and right by my office.  I'll be frequenting this place when I forget my lunch.

The set up of this is very similar to Chipotle - pick a base (rice, noodles, tortilla), a meat, veggies, and sauce.  So far I've tried the tofu and chicken... I prefer the tofu.  You get 3 veggie options per order.  The veggies are green beans, summer veggies, egg (not a veg, but an option), black beans, kale, and I think some other items that I can't remember.  They're a bit overcooked, but flavorful.  

After veggies, you pick a sauce and a topper.  I like the ginger yum sauce or teriyaki.  For toppers, I don't recommend the guacamole... It always looks brown and nasty... But there are other choices to finish your dish.

Overall it's not a bad option.  It's fairly quick and gives you a nice option to the Thai or sushi in Settlers Ridge.

Checked this place out before seeing a movie and what a great surprise! It's set up chipotle style where you pick your base, your protein, and your toppings. Everything was super fresh and delicious. I had the bowl with noodles, chicken, kale, corn, green beans topped with Korean bbq sauce. The portions are out of this world! You get so much food. The manager came out and said hello to us and made sure we liked everything and that he's super happy with how things are going just based on word of mouth. They're super happy to guide you through the menu if you have no idea what to get. 10/10 and will definitely be back!

Like others said, this is Asian Chipotle.  The place is clean and when I went, it was rather quiet. The amount of chicken I was given was laughable.  I had to go searching for it in my bowl.  I tried the "Asian guacamole". Basically guacamole with sesame oil in it. Overall the flavor was nothing special, the rice was over cooked and the sauce I tried (garlic) was boring.  If I'm really hungry I'll eat there again. But, I won't be going out of my way to have it.

This was our lunch stop while driving to Illinois because sushi is just better than fast food. We start with the pork shumai dumpling  pan fried and they were delicious. We ordered the sunset roll, triple pepper roll and Alaska roll. They combinations of the raw fishes and sauces were on point and they were pretty good. My only negative comment is that ever couple of pieces I would get a chewy fascia is the fish which I didn't like. If the fish is cut correct it doesn't usually happen. Hence 4/5 stars. I would recommend this place.

Quick, tasty, and satisfying. 

Stopped by at lunch during the week. I've been to similar restaurants but this was my first visit to Oryza. The line moved quickly and the choices of toppings are good. Overall, I felt like I got my money's worth and walked away satisfied. I will be back.

Stopped by Balance for lunch on a recent occasion. I really like these high quality food shops that let you pick your bowl ingredients. Since I'm minimizing carbs these days, I opted for a healthy bowl. I got some teriyaki chicken, veggies, noodles, and bean sprouts. The bowl was delicious and healthy. It's a nice getaway from Chipotle and it costs less than Rebol. Recommend!

A corporate catering order . The build your own bowl buffet with fresh, crisp pre-mixed vegetables, protein and carb/starch was a win.
The choice of two proteins went well; being flavorful chicken and the tender and moist steak.
 
For the carb/starch base being fried rice or wheat noodle as choices this first time around was good with the fried rice the overall winner.
 
Additional toppings of cilantro, onion, crisp sprouts and hot peppers made the dishes extra special.
 
The three sauce selections of Sassy Me, Four Star and Thai Guy seemed to be a good fit for all with Sassy Me taking the lead.

I asked guests which bowls were the favorite and the majority said that they did not make a specific style of bowl but added a little of everything from the buffet.
 
The amazing snack choice of warm, creamy wontons and citrus Brussel sprouts became a main dish for many who went back for more and more til gone! The citrus glaze Brussel sprouts were perfectly soft-crunchy, with crispy edges and so flavorful and was the first tray to be emptied.
 
I ordered for 20 and had 14 guests who gave immediate compliments.  There was plenty of food and I am confident that everyone went back for more until the trays were emptied.
 
Many said they were looking forward to visiting Balance Grille when in Cleveland for great fresh, clean Asian-fusion cuisine.
 
The labels were noticed for the content and dietary breakdown of calories, sodium, fat, etc. and that is an excellent bonus for the health conscious; although, I observed that the majority over indulged in the delicious portions, that speaks to the two thumbs up.
 
The food arrived hot and delicious and on time, and if I could be confident that it would arrive on time every time, I would have it delivered just prior to the meeting so that everyone could enjoy it hot. 
 
Thank you for the introduction to Balance Grille and for setting up the buffet.

Just arrived in Cleveland for a conference, I stumbled across this delightful place close to my hotel. The workers were kind and personable, and helped me make a wonderful selection for my meal. The service was fast, the portions generous, and I could not be more pleased. I will be back!

Recently, I've been to Balance twice and I have zero shame about it. I cannot remember any time, ever, I was this excited about a fast casual spot. And even better, they also deliver UberEats if you're not quite on the main part of Euclid Avenue in Downtown Cleveland (where parking can be hard).

Balance is a new, healthy spot in Downtown Cleveland for highly customizable tacos, salads and bowls. You choose the starch, protein and sauce. The staff is also super friendly and always quick to offer recommendations. Because its so customizable its effortlessly gluten-free, vegan and vegetarian friendly! So far, I love the Wiseman - a simple szechuan sauce served with broccoli, carrots, corn, fresh sprouts and kale. Customize it with the steak and brown rice. The steak is seasoned perfectly! The bowl is so huge and fresh that I use but a few drops of the sauce and I never feel guilty afterwards.

I also love the bubble tea and the Swiss Beets appetizer, made with sweet pickled beets and swiss chards. I cannot explain why this tangy snack is so immensely satisfying. Like, how does a person crave beets? Who am I?! But really, any business that can help you eat your colors for this reasonable of a price should be knighted by the Queen.

Great service and great tasting sashimi!  Being from out of town I almost missed the entrance because the place next door says it is vacant.  Looked inside the door and saw the food rating with the name on it.  It was worth the extra effort!
Not a fan. Their options did not go together whatsoever and the sauces were cheap and inauthentic. I won't be going back.

Delicious everytime! Sushi is fresh and everything we have ever tried has been amazing. The wait is always a little long (for pick up) but that shows how much people like this place. And its small so they can only do so much. If you want sushi and are near, try it out! You wont be disappointed!

I didn't even take a photo I was so hungry, but it was beautiful and amazing. I'll be sure to return so I will take a photo then.  We got take out which was ready very promptly when they said it would be.  The restaurant itself was very small but looked clean and well kept. 

We got:

Beauty and the beast - probably my least favorite special roll we got but still very good
Lemon salmon - really good flavors. I've never had lemon on sushi before and I loved it!
Crazy tuna - DELICIOUS. Will definitely be getting again. 
Futo maki roll - loved the pickle in it 
Dallas roll - just okay 
Spicy yellowtail - delicious!

I can't wait to go back and try more!
Our local go-to for take out. Good food and the owner is always very nice when I go in for my order- clean.
Excited to try a new sushi place and Yoshino did not disappoint. Great menu selection and decor. Friendly service. And most important excellent sushi!

Menu online is very old, I will include an updated menu below. Other than that the food is your standard issue Chinese takeout, nothing gourmet but not straight from the garbage can. Would recommend if your in the area.

One of my favorite lunch spots in downtown Cleveland. I love the convenience of pre-ordering and paying on the app and then just stopping in to pick it up 15 minutes later. The app lets you mix it up and customize any order, and I've never experienced any screw ups with my food. The service is excellent and the food is consistently good. It does get really busy around lunch time so there are a lot of people standing around and hovering, which makes dining-in somewhat annoying.

Came here to kill some time, my dog was getting a grooming session in, anyway, a little different then I'm use, which is a treat for myself. Most of the dishes i was use to but there  were some dishes that were missing that we like, besides the fact that we were gonna get the pu pu platter, but passed for one a bit pricey and it was missing two items and doubled up on two others. 
  With all that being said it was a very nice visit, staff was friendly, food was again different, the broth was more of a natural and lite tasting with the won ton, the dish i had was empress chicken and suppose to be spicy which it was byt really mild. Again these are not bad attributes just different the use. The art work was very attractive. We would visit again if out in the area for something.

Balance Pan-Asian Grille is my go-to spot for a fresh, filling, and healthy meal near Playhouse Square, the Q, or Progressive Field.   Many of the nearby restaurants focus on heavy, meaty, bar food, which I also love (especially with a cold IPA) but they leave you feeling tired by the time you make it to the game or show.  At Balance you can choose between healthy, hearty or both!  The prices are fair for the portions and they definitely don't skimp on flavor.

All the snacks are amazing.  My two personal favorites are the citrus brussel sprouts and the bangbang nachos.  The citrus brussels are crispy and the bangbang sauce could make a shoe taste good. My bronze medal snack would be the sweet potato salad because the sweet soy glaze gives it such a lasting punch.

For larger appetites any of the bowls work.  My favorite is the wiseman with chicken on greens because of the spicy Szechuan sauce (add a little bangbang sauce to kick it up a notch), but the tacos are better than the bowls and will keep me coming back.  I am a chicken taco lover so I enjoy getting a 3 pack of the SxSE, BangBang and SoHo tacos, but truth be told I can't get enough of the BangBang and SxSe.  

I know my review reads like a bangbang sauce billboard but trust me the menu has much more.  There are variations on Thai, Korean, even Indian flavors in addition to the normal Chinese -American styles you find around. Plus I love being able to see all my ingredients from prep to cook.  It doesn't get much fresher than that. 

If you want a flavorful healthy meal downtown swing by balance.  I bet you leave with a full stomach, a bag of leftovers and some energy to take on the night instead of taking a nap.  Oh, and if you are sometimes anti-social like me, they have a good app for ordering, major bonus points in my book.
Great little place.  Really good sushi and not too expensive!  The owner is really nice.  It's nice to have a local sushi place that is actually worth going to.  We definitely will visit again.

You will be disappointed if you hold the big city standards (paris baguette, tour les jours from LA/Chicago) but we are in Madison and it's the closest it can get.

The place is fairly small but friendly staff, hong kong egg tart, sausage bun, pork bun was pretty good! Will be back for occasional asian bakery fix.

Finally, 2014 was an Asian progress in Madison's food world! I'm so grateful to come close to some sort of Asian bakery... Previously, the only options were day- or week- old pastries from Chicago sold in the local Asian marts... :(

Asian sweet bakery is NOT just a bakery, you can get typical chinese food as well. Indeed, when I visit again, it would be mainly for the breakfast food, not the baked goods. The owner and cashier is chinese, and speak chinese and cantonese. I would describe this Asian style as mainly cantonese, due to the presence of congee, sweet top (what I call pineapple bun) and sesame balls.

What's good:
Congee with pork
Fried dough stick (almost as good as in Asia)
Sweet top bun (no filling)
Crepes (decent)

Don't bother:
Sesame ball (too much dough, weird custard filling inside)
Egg tarts (too sweet)
Beef brisket noodles (no flavor in the soup or beef :|) 

I think they still have improvement for baked goods, but overall I enjoy the congee and fried dough stick, a typical breakfast food in Hong Kong or Asia. Also, the sweet top buns are a treat! I love to heat them up at home, and put in a thick slab of butter after heating the buns! LOVE IT!

P.S. if Asian Sweet Bakery has some Asian desserts.... that would really be a star attraction!!!
Still amazing! We LOVED the Christmas roll and I would probably skip the foreplay roll, it had way too much cream cheese. We got edamame and soup and could not finish all these rolls.

Asian tacos I was skeptical ate here because I was curious didn't expect to much. Maybe it should be tacos with a Asian twist. Anyway wow I was not disappointed. They have a taco trio where you can pick any three tacos of the five they offer which is what I ordered on my visit. Would definitely recommend the pad thai and orange crunch tacos I also had the mango taco I liked it less, not because it wasn't good but just didn't have the mango flavor I was expecting.
Balance is amazing and so unique. I've tried two of their bowls and was blown away by both. It can be really healthy as well based on what you add into your bowl and use as the base.
I love this bakery shop mainly because the Chinese bakery is really authentic. Also, the price is reasonable, too. I used to stop by here when I go to the clinic.
The food is of amazing quality! Clean place. Service is great! Very generous portions. Cannot wait to go back. Well done Zuki staff!!
Food is ok. The ladies are really friendly. Good customer service. Never overly crowded. Prices are good.
Their sushi is delicious!!! The wait time is average. The employees are very nice and helpful and you get to watch your sushi being made. They offer alot more than just sushi too.
Amazing sushi served very beautifully.  Staff is fantastic. Very large amount of options to choose from. Love this place

This place has a cool, futuristic vibe which I liked butttt the food was simply just okay. There's really not much to say except I wasn't impressed. I ordered the wiseman bowl which came with a very good Szechuan sauce on the side but even when I mixed it in to the bowl, it didn't really have the essence of a finished, cooked bowl. I know this wasn't a hibachi place but usually the ingredients come together as one dish (even Chipotle can pull this off).
