Maybe it's just me and my taste buds but I don't know if I'd go back here given the chance.

Bizzare is the only word I have to define our experience here. I went within a few weeks of opening so take that into account as you read this review. We walked in on a Friday night and were sat immediately. They immediately brought us water, but it took a while to get service. We did finally get a server and tried to order drinks. They don't have a liquor license so they had complimentary wine and beer. They were out of beer and only had Moscato for wine. Moscato is too sweet for me so I stuck with the water.

We ordered and all our food was good, but our service was just bizarre. Every time we asked a question we were met with weird answers or he would say yes, I'm just about to get that when clearly he'd just forgotten.

The most bizarre part was when our friend ordered a California roll and he recommended upgrading to the Flipped Roll which is a roll with mango on top. It really wasn't similar to the California roll at all?

The food was good, but I got the monster and flipped roll. Both had way too much sauce on them for my liking. If I give them another shot, I'd probably get to go food.

Don't be fooled by the sketchy exterior and location of Asian Sweet Bakery - I avoided it for years because of the appearance and this was probably one of my greatest mistakes. My friend finally dragged me inside to eat one day and it actually blew my mind. 

This is one of the first places that is truly, authentically Chinese. My favorite thing is to order a pork rib crepe (the sauce is delicious, and the meat is so tender) with Chinese century egg and pork congee with a cup of fresh-made, hot soy milk. Makes me feel right at home and so, so delicious!

They also have a wonderful assortment of bakery items - from BBQ pork buns to mochi, coconut toasted buns to sesame balls, this place can definitely satisfy your sweet cravings. Make sure to come early to order egg tarts because they sell out fast!

The restaurant itself is small and simple inside. Things are also served on a paper plate with disposal utensils, which kind of sucks but is also pretty accurate to how some things are served in Asia haha. 

So happy to have this place in Madison. A wonderful gem - thank you, Asian Sweet Bakery for making my day always so much sweeter!

I was on my way home from an event craving sushi and someone recommended Zuki. 

We stopped in about an hour before close so they weren't super busy. 

The inside is really small maybe having 8 total tables and they have seats at the sushi bar. 

The menu is good sized and features a big lunch section. 

I didn't try and alcohol or even glance at that section of the menu. 

sushi: we got a sweet potato roll for an appetizer because i had never had one and recently fell in love with sweet potatoes. It was delicious!! Served warm. 

I ordered the bento box for my meal and got beef. $20. It was huge. First it came with miso soup (they were out so gave us clear soup) and the house salad. These were pretty standard. The box itself came with a California roll, 3 pieces of Shumai, 2 shrimp tempura rice and the meat. I chose the beef teriyaki and it was just amazing. 

There was no music playing so it was very quiet inside so that was slightly awkward but other than that it was great!

KK: it's been awhile since I've written one of these. This place is GREAT! The food is fantastic, tho I know you wouldn't be partial. Service is prompt without the overservice you sometimes get in such spots. Realizing how much you hate being overserved, even when service is good is a skill your provider has learned well over the past year. Seems the less you get, the happier you seem. Soon, it's possible, that service can stop altogether, if that's what it will take to make you happiest. Not *my* personal preference, but it is what it is. Adjusting expectations, slowly but surely.

I feel like these build your own bowl places are popping up all over, so I was a little skeptical trying this place for my first time but the skepticism was quickly put to rest. The sauces have flavor, and they give you plenty of sauce to cover, but not drown your bowl. They also have tacos on the menu, which I have not tried yet, but if they mirror the quality of the bowls, they have got to be pretty good. Ingredients tasted and appeared to be super fresh, and one bowl is plenty of food for a single individual. The workers too are always smiling, and super friendly. It is busy during lunch, and appears like chaos, but everything runs so smoothly, and the crowd really does not get in the way of the great food and service. This is now my go to lunch spot near public square.

Small place. Every seat was taken. The fried rice was amaze balls. Veggie sushi was great. Large variety of rolls and other plates. Food came out very fast. They also have hibachi which we will try another time.  Great meal.

I had my first experience here yesterday and it was... weird and uncomfortable.

So I came here with my friend and I was a little nervous because I wasn't familiar with the setup but quickly realized it's similar to Chipotle or Subway. So I go up to order my "wrap" (it's a burrito) and two people were behind me in line which made me want to rush. I got my meat, none of the vegetables looked appealing and then I got guacamole and cheese. When we got to the meat the guy asked me if that was enough. Confused, I said "I guess, yeah." The reason I was I confused is because at Chipotle they give you a set amount of meat and if you want more you pay extra so I'm not used to being asked if that's enough. I pay my $10 for my "wrap" and a fountain drink and I sit down and rip it in half so I can eat it easier and... it's the saddest little burrito you've ever seen. There's no heft/bulk to this thing at all. I turned to my friend and said "I wish this had rice or something." He pointed to the menu and showed me rice is an option. Now I'll admit, this was my fault for rushing. *I* missed the rice. I wasn't asked if I wanted rice but I also didn't see it. So despite normally being too anxious/afraid to go back up and ask for something else, I did. I went up and said "I'm sorry, can I get a side of rice? I missed it when I was up here." My plan was to stuff the rice into the burrito myself. The guy told me to bring my burrito back but I was trying not to be difficult and I said "I already ripped it in half" and his response was "I don't give a shit." ...This was where I started getting anxious/uncomfortable - was he mad at me? I couldn't tell. So I went and grabbed my burrito and he took it from me and said "I don't normally do this" and in my head I was thinking, I didn't ask you to do this. I just wanted some rice! So he steams a new tortilla and dumps the contents of my previous "wrap" onto the new tortilla and grabs some kind of pink rice. I wanted white rice but at this point I am NOT asking for anything else. I already feel like this guy is mad at me. He adds a little extra meat and cheese which was nice of him but then he said a second time "I don't normally do this" which is where I started to get angry. I didn't ask you to do this, sir! & do what, exactly? Give me food that I paid for? I've worked in food before so I always try to be extra polite to food workers and I know I was polite, apologized and blamed myself when I asked for some rice so... I don't understand why it was such a production. Also I waited for the two people behind me to be done and there was no one else in line so I wasn't holding anyone up. I just wanted some rice, man.

The food was actually really good but I'm waiting at least a few months before I go back so hopefully that guy won't recognize me.

I've probably eaten here about once a week since it opened and I'm always happy with my order.  I can recommend the bubble tea and anything with the Wok Fired Steak.  

Make sure to download the app for your phone.  You can order ahead of time, earn points for your orders and fully customize your order all with the App.

Go elsewhere.

I was needing some General Tso's and other Americanized Chinese fare for lunch.  Having already tried one place downtown and coming up short I figured I'd give Golden Palace a try.  Fail.  Golden Palace's buffet is on a table that measures 15' x 3' and doesn't offer much variety.  This would make me think the limited choices make for better food.  Wrong.
The food housed on this small table is not fresh, is not tasty, and is not appealing.  I was almost tempted to just ask for my money back.  Instead I rolled the dice and tried the General Tso's, the fried rice, and the chicken and peppers.  Hope you like gristle, salt, and high fructose corn syrup because it's all you're going to taste.

Bleck.

Golden Palace is also expensive. 
*I began with a 2 star, but relegated it to 1*

For (aspiring) vegetarians like us  there are lots of options at this place. Ingreduents are decently fresh. Note spicy really means spicy. The spicy sesame sauce took us to the limit. The advertising says that the chicken and beef are hormone and antibiotic free.

Not a bad place for fast and healthy food.

After my Harness Cycle class, I went just across the street to Balance Pan-Asian Grille for lunch. While the line was long, due to the number of businesspeople who were also hungry for food, it passed by super quickly, and I was able to get my order within 5 minutes of speaking with the cashier person.

The concept is pretty simple - choice of sauce and veggies, protein, and carb. Normally, when I order at restaurants like this, I ask for the sauce to be on the side. But Balance Pan-Asian Grille already pre-packs their sauces in separate containers, which is nice. All in all, the food was pretty decent, not to mention the restaurant is kept so clean. The only major criticism I had about the place is that the flavors don't really mesh together. Essentially, I got a heap of vegetables, some chicken on the bottom, and sauce for dipping/drizzling on top of everything. This is something I can definitely make at home myself, but I will say Balance Pan-Asian Grille is nice in terms of convenience.

Nice bakery with lots Asian £¨hongkong£©style breads and treats. 

ÓÍÌõÅäÆ¤µ°ÊÝÈâÖàºÜºÃ³Ô£¬Å£ëîÃæÒ²ºÜºÃ¡£Ð¡µê£¬Ã»¼¸ÕÅ×À×Óµ«ÊÇºÜ¶àÊ³ÎïºÜ²»´í£¬ÖµµÃÒ»ÊÔ¡£

Balance is always a win. Download the app and order if doing carry out. The food is always ready ahead of specified time and you earn points and free items just for downloading. 

The food is very fresh and I've never had a bad experience. The tacos are nice and not what you would expect. Take a chance on the blue corn shell which is actually a soft tortilla. My favorite hands down is the bowls. You can pretty much customize them to your liking within the parameters of the offerings listed. My go to is the wiseman bowl, but with the sassy me sauce. I add steak and it's a win. 

The staff is courteous and friendly. An extra added bonus to top off the great food. It's no wonder this place is growing in popularity on the downtown lunch circuit.

The sushi was really good and really fresh.  Service was fast too.   My only complaint is that they need to expand the desert menu and make the deserts a bit more authentic.  I've been to many sushi restaurants and deserts complete any kind of cuisine no matter how full you are.  I would love to see them carry japanese ice cream among other authentic Japanese style deserts.

Fresh sushi every time. Though I've always gotten carry out, I can tell you that this restaurant holds a max of about 30 people. While it is very small, this place will stay busy all day and night. The only constructive criticism would be to add more sushi chefs to keep the food coming out faster. That said, the finished product is well worth the wait. Only better sushi restaurant around is Kasai in Wadsworth.

Good heavens above was I sad that I happened to be smack dab in the center of Fort Wayne, Indiana for a work trip on the night of our Yelp Elite event. I had been looking forward to trying this Asian Mexican fusion experience for far too long. Well, weird part of Indiana, you won't hold a girl back too long upon her return to the Buckeye State. My boyfriend and I decided to hit it up shortly after the event... after all, the raves of my fellow Elites really sent me spinning with jealousy. Blasphemy, you lucky consumers of fresh delicious food!

The girl at the counter was above and beyond any type of "cashier" I had ever had. Absolutely charismatic, made us feel like we were family, and truly hosted the entire experience as if it was a tour of our taste buds. So many kudos Emily! You were funny, kind and a fantastic employee. They are lucky to have you!

So here we are, with choices galore, and not exactly sure what direction to go... but my greens loving machine of a bod (this is a joke because I love cheese far more than greens, but on this particular night I was feeling the freshest) steered us towards edamame and brussel sprouts to start. There. Could. Not. Have. Been. Anything. Better. You guys - whatever citrus glaze they marinate those sprouts in really took me on a ride. They were piping hot, the absolutely perfect amount of crunch to soft and flaky ratio, and legittttt the sauce melted in your mouth. I was done right there. I could have eaten two helpings of brussels and never tried another thing on the menu and been a regular forevermore.  Well, as luck would have it, eating purely starter veggies wasn't in the cards. The edamame was absolutely fantastic too, by the way. The little carton it came in truly seemed to be endless. A smidge too much salt for my liking but I just brushed it off. The temperature and texture of the edamame was what really mattered.

We tried the Bang Bang tacos on blue corn as well as a General Tso's bowl. Holy mother of god are they not joking when they say Bang Bang is "spicy" - y'all, this isn't your Bang Bang Shrimp from Bonefish Grille kind of spicy. No slight sriracha infused mayo up in this joint. This was straight burning your lips sizzzzzzllllleee. I mean, I liked it, but even as a spice lover, I could only do so much. I almost think I'd rather put the sauce on the side and apply for myself. Nevertheless, be careful on these things!

The bowl was perfectly fresh and the meat was tender... tasty rice and crunchy veggies. Who can ask for more?!

I would in a heart beat return here for not only the most precious of accommodations, but the location is sweet, the price is right, the ambiance is simple yet modern, and there are these huge stainless steel fridges with glass doors so that you can literally see that all of their produce is FRESH.

I'm stunned. This will absolutely become a favorite for me!!! Thanks, BPAG!

Very good food at a reasonable price.  I'm vegan and it was easy to build a bowl full of veggies and beans with red rice.  Very clean restaurant and staff was nice.  One big downside - they yell "WELCOME TO ORZYA" whenever anyone walks in the door.  It's annoying and way too loud.  I don't go to a restaurant to be yelled at, I go to enjoy food and hopefully peace and quiet.

GLUTEN / DAIRY FREE PARADISE!!  Everything is GF DF besides the obvious wraps or tortilla chips.  The marinades and all of the sauces are a go, where does that ever happen?  Excellent high quality food, can't wait to return.

I'm always happy when I decide to splurge on lunch here.  It's sushi, so I spend at least $15 including tip, sometimes more.

They do have a reasonable lunch selection, including sushi combos that include miso soup and a house salad with ginger dressing (YUM!) as well as bento boxes and even hibachi!

I usually get the sushi combo but one of these days I'm going to pick an adorable bento box!  You can pick 2 or 3 smaller maki rolls for $10-13.  Like I said before, you also get the soup and salad to start.

My last visit I chose the Alaskan Dream special roll and purchased a house salad.  The menu salad is much larger than the one they provide with the combo.  The roll itself was 10 pieces and the flavor was average.  There were panko crumbs in the center and I found a couple really hard inedible pieces.  I simply set them to the side and continued eating, but it's something I'll consider in the future when an item has panko.

They do some really pretty plating on some of the selections.  A woman I was seated next to got a plate of sashimi and they had flowers and a martini glass with lights going, it was a whole spectacle.  Really cool.

Overall, I love this place.  Reasonably priced and consistent.  The hard crumbs were the first time I had anything negative happen.  I shall return for a bento box, soon.

The food is so good when my son walks out of that restaurant he said can we go back in 2 weeks that's how good the food is I recommend the spice crap sushi clear soup and calamari salad and also sea food soup great food

Truly a hidden gem! Located in a small business complex so trying to find a parking spot is hard to get. Once inside, the dining room is small that it don't fit many people but with the spectacular and fresh menu the food is worth the wait! You can tell the chefs take great pride into their craft and everything is made to the slightest detail and their presentation of their food is beautiful.  I never had one bad experience with the food nor staff, sushi was fresh and delicious tasting and everything is made to order. There are times that i order more than one sushi roll and each roll has its own look and the flavors are phenomenal.  My favorite rolls are the Beauty and the beast, Alaska beauty roll, sunset roll, foreplay roll and the Christmas roll.  Even the sashimi is incredible!

This place is 10 minutes from my house. I was craving sushi had great reviews so I decided to try. 

Small place but mighty in sushi. Got the shumei, spicy tuna, crab rangoon, dragon roll, and california roll. It was all delicious and excellent. 

Here is the bottom line. Sushi is very good. Lots of choices. The prices are very reasonable. Good for eat in or take out. Also have regular asian like teriyaki chicken, lo mein, and such. Also have bento boxes. 

I will be a regular. This is a new favorite.

I admit I've been lying in wait for this place to open like a foodie stalker. And it did not disappoint. The the General Manager, Matt, and the Kitchen Manager, Matt (who goes by Bing), came right over to greet me warmly and asked if I had any questions.
I didn't, because the signs above the food bar clearly state how to order. First you pick your base, such as rice noodles, red rice, or white rice. Then you pick your protein (chicken, tofu or steak). Finally, you pick vegetables and accoutrements to top it off. Bing asked me what I'd like. I don't have allergies and I'm not a picky eater so I said surprise me. He grinned. "Great! I'll give you my favorite!" and he loaded my bowl with rice noodles, grilled chicken, sauteed vegetables, green beans, chipotle sauce, corn, and at my request, a tiny bit of shredded cheese and some fresh,  red onion. As he handed it to me, I wondered if my medical covered a hernia. The bowl was brimming with delicious-looking, fresh and colorful food, and was heavy.

I dropped my bowl off at a gleaming black, polished marble top table in a booth, and headed to the drink station, directly across from the entrance. They have water, Sobe Pomegranate Yumberry, Mountain Dew, Raspberry ice tea, and 1 or 2 others. I had Raspberry ice tea, then the Sobe Pomegranate Yumberry, which has long been a favorite of mine.

There's a long row of counter seating along the front window, 4 high tops (tables), and about 6 or so, large, comfy booths.
Matt, the GM, checked on me. All good. 
Then his manager, Gary, came over and talked when I was finished. He said he had open a lot of restaurants, including Blaze Pizza across the way, both here, West Virginia, and in California. He explained that though this was fast casual, the company is very committed to healthy fare. The eggs are cage-free. All their chicken and steak are hormone and antibiotic-free. The vegetables are fresh. I was impressed that the vegetables, especially the onions and zucchini, were not overcooked. The chunks of chicken and noodles were perfect, and Bing used just enough Chipotle sauce for a zingy-spicy kick. I'm dying to try a bowl with red rice, tofu, and vegetables, with ginger yum sauce next time. Turns out that's Bing's second favorite. 

I ordered dessert to go, a Yum Tart, which looked like a mini tart. Bing told me the ingredients,  but he had me at caramel. The top was artfully decorated in a latte-like swirl. It was so good, it never made it to my car (Hey, I'm not proud. Just honest).

There's only 2 reasons why I deducted a star. They have a very limited beverage selection. Personally, I try to limit my sugar  (No health issues. A lower sugar diet makes me feel better, and keeps my 5'1" frame looking good). I already had figured in dessert, so I was hoping for ice tea. Also, I don't drink soda anymore, and usually have ice tea.

The other reason was the dining room is boring. It's stark, sleek, and functional. The "art" is limited to the huge posters explaining the company's name, commitment to healthy eating and to the environment. Nothing on the tables. A vase of flowers, a candle, or floating candle would be a nice touch, giving it a warm atmosphere.

I guess when you have employees from the very top on down, that are warm and friendly and have a true passion for their jobs, it does take the edge off the stark dining room.

Phenomenal and tasty and cheap. Use their app to order ahead. First time I went during lunch hour, there was quite a wait. I first discovered it just a couple weeks ago and have already been back 4-5 times.

I came here once before and I stand by the fact that this is a fantastic addition to downtown Cleveland. Fresh, clean Asian-fusion cuisine - perfect for lunch. 

The interior is minimalistic but clean and nice. The kitchen is behind a giant glass so you see the people work but it somehow doesn't feel intrusive.

This time around I ordered a Wiseman Bowl ($8.50) on a bed of brown rice (they do have an option of white rice as well as a fresh greens as your base) with chicken as my protein. I love that the dressing comes on the side. I also ordered the Creamy Wontons ($5.00) because they are delicious. To top it off, I got the taro bubble tea.

The food is great and customizable. The staff if friendly and give great suggestions if you're not sure what to get.

If I'm downtown for lunch, I'm definitely coming back!

Great place. I ordered the Buddha with steak and noodles and originally bubble tea. 

The buddy was great. Enough food but not heavy. Felt full at the end and I eat a lot. Also the got the bang bang sauce on the side which added good amount of heat. 

The original bubble tea is great. Not too sweet but still very good. Will come again.
Best Egg Foo Young east of the Mississippi!  All their food is prepared with the very best fresh whole food which is unique for your typical USA Chinese restaurant.  Ambience average, food excellent!

Ordered shrimp tempura and California rolls, I know I need to expend my sushi... rolls were very loose and the shrimp tempura so about as thin as I have ever seen, also take a look only one shrimp used and the tail was put in the last one....

Everything tasted good, but had the feeling it was kinda skimpy on the ST

SHORT VERSION: Balance Pan-Asian Grille is a well thought out, much needed, fresh and healthy concept for the Euclid corridor. A few small tweaks, and this might be the best fast, casual lunch in all of downtown Cleveland. 

LONG VERSION: They have a beautiful, open, contemporary design, with large, floor to ceiling windows along the front of the parcel. Once you enter, it's just as open and well put together inside. Clean, crisp, and still felt shiny and new, even after being open almost a full year. Immediately upon entering, you see a sign directing you to the right for placing and order, and to the left for online/pickup. 

We made our way to the right where they had three large LED screens with the menu. It was a little awkward, as you really had to look almost straight up by the time you reached the front of the line. We made our choices and proceeded to the counter to place our order. Another little flaw was the menu screens I mentioned earlier are actually behind you and to the right once you actually place your order. So I had to turn around and glance over the people in line behind us, apologizing as I felt like I was holding things up a bit. 

I decided on a sweet and sour bowl, with brown rice for the starch, and grilled steak for the protein. I also ordered some creamy wontons, and a taro milk tea with tapioca pearls. 

Like I mentioned, they had a TON of drink options (milk tea, bubble tea, iced tea, frozen tea, fancy bottled waters, and a few random "high end" cans/bottles in a grab n' go cooler at the order counter.) The one thing I did find a little odd, was that you couldn't just order a good old Diet Coke, either on the fountain or in a bottle. While a $6 bubble tea was fine once, I'd prefer a more economical soda option if I was making regular visits. The vibe I got from this place however, is that soda is probably considered "bad". Which, let's be honest, it mostly is; but it's still vastly popular. 

Once we had our order placed, we grabbed a seat and waited 4-5 minutes until they called my name and we returned to the window to grab lunch. It was served on a chic little wooden tray, perfectly holding two bowls, a side, a few sauces, and a drink. 

My bowl had kale, red onions and carrots, with a base of brown rice and wok-fried steak. It came with a traditional sweet and sour sauce (the red gooey, sweet sauce you've been getting with your Chinese takeout for years). Everything went well together, with the sweetness of the sauce mixing with the savory of the steak, while getting that crunchy mouth feel from the kale and carrots. Admittedly, I'm more of a "meat and potatoes" kind of guy, but this still was something I'd happily order again. For being fast, and healthy, it was surprisingly filling.

That also may have been aided by the creamy wontons (four in the order, deep fried with a side of the same sweet and sour sauce) and the taro milk tea I had with my meal. The tea, was similar to those I've gotten elsewhere. Mixed in a plastic cup after a cellophane lid is applied, you stab the top with your oversized straw, and enjoy the beverage. I would have preferred a little ice, but wasn't given the option. I think next time I'll ask, only because something as overly sweet as a bubble tea needs to stay chilled in my opinion, or it becomes almost too sweet once it comes to room temp.

As pricing goes, it's right on par with what you'd expect at a downtown fast/casual. I believe the bowl was $8.50 with a .50 up-charge for the steak. The wontons were $4 and the bubble tea ended up being $6 for a small. I think there was an up-charge for almond milk, but they didn't mention it. One of my little pet peeves is up-charge items not being mentioned upon ordering. 

The only thing negative I have to say about this place, and I don't even think negative is the right word... is the layout of the dining room. We were sat fairly close to the pickup window, and about halfway through our meal, there were so many people standing around waiting for their order, that they were almost in my lap. There didn't seem to be any kind of method to the madness, as bodies were basically just everywhere. It kind of reminded me of waiting on the subway in New York. It wasn't a huge deal, but had we been wanting to talk, or go over business stuff, it would have been next to impossible. Again, that's probably on me for expecting space and relative quiet at noon on a busy weekday lunch rush. 

Overall, Balance has a really good vibe, with an equally good presentation and taste. If I worked nearby, I'd probably end up being there at least once a week, if not more. I love to see a new concept downtown, especially one that brings healthy options with it. I like breweries and bbq as much as the next guy, but sometimes you just want to eat something that satisfies your hunger, without that "blah" feeling an hour later. Balance certainly checks off that box, and does it in style.
First time here. Great food and service. Worth trying: crab ragoon, mushroom soup and lo mein (latter two free with hibachi)

This place has awesome, fresh, delicious food. I got the four star, so fresh and great tasting. My wife got the pad thai tacos, they are out of this world. The citrus Brussels and creamy won tins are excellent.

Honestly, it was really tough choose a healthy option over my beloved Taco Bell or even pizza 216 (shout out) but this place was sooooo good. Not only was the food healthy AND delicious I feel really good after eating it too. 
Pictured below :
(Chicken bowl,  fried rice  with sassy me sauce 
And wontons)
Bomb sushi and great option for the area. Not the friendliest customer service but it depends! The sushi is good and moderately priced

This has become my go to Sushi spot in the area. Everything is fresh and tastes really good.

The prices are very reasonable and they are very prompt. I have never eaten there but the dining room seems nice. A little small but it rarely seems too crowded. I think this is more of a take out place.

I tend to get spicy tuna, shrimp tempura and have tried various specialty rolls. All have hit the spot.

Stay away from the calamari as it is very chewy.

That is really the only thing that i have not liked on the menu.

Very good "American" Chinese food. Our food came piping hot and very generous portions for the price. Our table all got the combination platters and were stuffed afterwards (entree + soup + egg roll). The wonton soup was one of the better I've had in terms of flavor. Aside from the food, the interior is old school Chinese restaurant but it gives charm. The owners are also very kind!

I recently moved into the area and decided to give Zuki Sushi House a try based on the 5 star reviews. I feel that I am obligated to write an HONEST review for others like me who rely on Yelp as a helpful guide when selecting businesses. The food at this restaurant is horrible and the place is dirty. I have eaten sushi and hibachi steak teriyaki at many places and never have I had such awful food. The steak teriyaki, fried rice, noodles and vegetables had an awful taste that I couldn't identify (not a spice, no idea what it was). It was so strong and nasty that it made the entire meal inedible (even with soy sauce added to it). The "steak" actually looked like boiled chunks of a cheap cut of meat. It was definitely NOT stir fried. The "fried" rice was definitely not fried, it was steamed and sitting in the watery liquid from the meat (so were the noodles and vegetables). I literally felt sick and disgusting after attempting to eat my meal. I never should have accepted the meal and paid for it. What a complete waste of money and time. My Friday night was ruined. I feel fortunate that I didn't get food poisoning. This was definitely a bad choice and I regret giving it a chance. I could NOT ever recommend this place to anyone. Trust my review, it's real and 100% HONEST
Fantastic food and service. Our food was fresh and the hibachi was amazing. The sushi is also very good and my family will be back!

Extremely inconsistent w both quality and price. Last time I went it was a $1 up charge for an ounce of eel sauce on the side yet tonight it was $2 for the same side of sauce. The sushi can be great one day, but then be underwhelming for the same roll on a different date. 

If you're in a pinch, it's fine but I wouldn't rely on them to be your regular sushi place.

Pretty sure I've spent several paychecks in here by now. They have delicious tacos, flavor packed bowls, hot won tons and incredible Brussels sprouts. With the help of their app I can order ahead of time and walk out with my food in no time. Plus I earn food items with my points. Who'd thought I'd ever fall in love with a healthy taco???

Like an Asian Chipotle but with absolutely no flavor to anything. The yum yum sauces are the only good part to this restaurant even though they seem pretty watered down. The chicken was over cooked, dry and chewy while the shrimp was over cooked and just disintegrated into mush. The man at the second half of the toppings bar didn't change gloves between handling the cash register and serving my food and even left them on to cash me out as well. After payment, he returned my card to me with the same unwashed dirty glove hand that he used for the people before me, leaving grease and food residue on the card for me to place back in my wallet.

Their sushi is delicious!!! The wait time is average. The employees are very nice and helpful and you get to watch your sushi being made. They offer alot more than just sushi too. I love it every time.

Delicious sushi, great service. We're happy we stumbled upon this place! 

We live about 2 hours away, and we were in town to do some shopping. We had tried out a few other places, but they were all closed on a Monday!? Then we stumbled upon Yoshino, which was most definitely open on a Monday, and I'm happy we found it! 

This place offers Chinese, Japanese, and Thai food, but we were craving sushi, so we stuck to that menu. The roll selection was decent, but not huge, but fair enough--the menu serves 3 different types of cuisine. Their specialty rolls were unique enough to make up for the limited selection. 

We got the Mount Everest roll and the Steeler roll, see pic. We also got a couple of hand rolls and several orders of nigiri. All of it was really tasty. The fish was fresh and the flavor combos were great. 

The staff were all friendly and attentive. We would definitely visit again, and maybe next time, venture into the rest of the menu.

I was downtown for a volunteer training meeting today (Saturday) and I decided to stop in to Balance Pan-Asian Grille. They opened in November 2018.

The food here can be compared to Chipotle, Piada Italian steet food, or Bibibop asian grill. The price here is a bit high for lunch ($8.50) for a bowl so the price here is similar to Piada. Chipotle and Bibibop are definitely a bit cheaper. You also can't really compare this place to Chipotle because you actually get vegetables here with your meal and you don't really at Chipotle except for corn and lettuce.

CASUAL RESTAURANT -- You order at the counter and wait for your order to be called out (similar to the other restaurants I mentioned above - Chipotle, etc).

LUNCH -- Delicious. I was very full after eating. I ordered the Wiseman bowl which comes with vegetables, your choice of protein (tofu, lentils, chicken, or steak) and your choice of a carb/starch base (brown rice, vegetables, etc). 

I got my bowl with brown rice and chicken. The vegetables in the Wiseman bowl are shredded carrots, corn, broccoli, kale, and bean sprouts. The szechuan sauce is what really completed the meal. It is basically soy sauce but has a slight sweetness to it. It is the perfect blend of sweet, spicy, and savoury. The sauce isn't spicy at all, at least for my taste buds because I love spicy foods.

DRINKS -- They sell traditional drinks (water and soft drinks or soda pop) but they have bubble tea. I didn't buy a bubble tea when I visited so I'll have to come back again a second time to try one. The have milk teas which you can get vegan by choosing Almond Milk. They also have iced-teas.

SERVICE -- Service was awesome. I was greeted when I entered and the menu was explained to me.

Overall, I recommend coming here for lunch. There are options for vegetarians and meat eaters alike. 

P.S. Order your lunch in advance during the week. I was told that they get very busy during the weekday (Mon. - Fri.) during the hours of 11am - 2pm, so lunch hours. I visited on a Saturday afternoon and it was very quiet. The guy behind the cashier told me that they are not busy at all on Saturdays and they are closed on Sundays. It's sad that this area of downtown doesn't get much visitors who want to eat or shop at the surrounding arcade building especially since the always popular 4th street gets very busy on weekends. I believe with the new apartment building being built in this part of downtown then perhaps more locals will stop by here to eat.

***
- 60 total reviews in 2019
- 269 total Yelp reviews
- Reviewed on 13 April 2019
- Ate here on 13 April 2019
Amazing service!  Great selection of sushi especially the specialty rolls. Has other great options as well if you are not a sushi person. My new go to sushi spot! Exceeded expectations!

Fast, healthy choices in downtown Cleveland! There are not enough restaurants like this on Euclid. 

The food is overall very good and flavorful, with a healthier spin. The one suggestion I would have is to make the tortillas for the tacos warm and crispy. They fell apart with all of the sauce.

Also, very good service - I ordered a bubble tea that for some reason did not sit well with me, and they generously remade another option for me.

Stopped in for a bubble tea and ended up also getting a tasty noodle bowl.  I was in at dinner time on a Tuesday and was the only one eating in.  Most of their business were to go orders.  I enjoyed the green melon milk tea with boba and the Thai guy bowl while sitting at the front window people watching E 4th.  The Thai guy is carrots, peapods, sprouts, crushed peanuts, cilantro and hot peppers (I had them on the side) served with Thai-style peanut sauce.  The meal had a kick without being too spicy.  It was large enough to have left overs for the next day...the bowl, there's no way a bubble would last longer than 10 minutes in my presence.

First the food was horrible and not fresh at all. Ive eaten the curry chicken w/onion combo and never had any taste this gamy. The food definitely did not taste fresh. There is a big issue with this place that i find morally wrong. The man who runs this restaurant has his daughters working the register while they play around at the shop. The younger one was throwing packets of cookies around while the other was yelling at her. But the oldestof the two young girls runs the register and she looks like she is 11 years old. Again, morally kids should not be working at such a young age.

I've been to the wonderful Morgantown location and stumbled upon this new one. Love that it is in a central location by the movies and it is very clean, fancy-looking and the staff is really friendly! Delicious, fresh bowls and wraps that accommodate my vegan diet (or any other diet) and are very filling - great for a family or date!

Balance might just be my go-to for quick, delicious vegan food downtown. I ordered through the app, which was simple to use *and* makes it super easy to customize dishes to make them vegan. Pro tip: they have almond milk for bubble tea! I had the Orange Crunch tacos with tofu, and they were fantastic. The "Whatever" bubble tea was great too. The staff are really friendly, all around a great experience.

The only places I ever think about getting sushi is downtown or in another town. Then I remember this place in town and I haven't been there yet. I am sure glad that I did. I got the monster roll, foreplay roll, and Christmas roll. All amazing! I know I will be back and the best part is it is only five minutes away. Lastly I went when they said it would be ready and they were just finishing up. Freshness is key with sushi!
This place is like an Asian chipotle, but better and healthier. Staff is super friendly and every ingredient was fresh. Their sauces are fantastic and service was quick. Will be back often for sure

Quick, tasty, quality food. Staff was very friendly and helpful which was a plus since it since it was my first time there and I  had many questions.    
Similar to Moe's and subway.   Pick a style : salad, wrap, or bowl.   Then pick your choices of protein, rice, veg's, beans, cheese, and sauce.   They have a variety of sides to go along with your meal like rice chip with salsa, pineapple, and soup.     You can plan on spending about $11 for a meal and a drink.   
 
Beware, parking can be a little tight since it is located by movie theater.   Watch on those busy movie nights.

Recommendation: get the fish fillet and tofu with rice combo, it is absolutely delicious! The portion of fish fillet and tofu is very generous to eat at any time of the day.

Typically, the congee combo is also pretty decent. I had wanted to get the B1 combo, but the cashier misheard and typed in a B2 combo which includes congee and 5 pan-fried pot stickers at $7. We ended up going with the B2 combo and the the pot stickers were crunchy with just the right amount of meat. The fried donut that I got was a bit cold, but it matches and goes well with the fish and preserved egg congee combo. 

All in all, I do like coming out to Asian Sweet Bakery to get the usual, occasionally switching for either the eel combo or trying some of the other fresh bakery items in the glass container.

I'm from Chicago, visiting Cleveland on business, and stumbled on this restaurant by chance. I don't usually write reviews, but feel compelled to since the food I ordered was so delicious! I ordered the Thai Guy Bowl and ate the whole generous portion of it. It was terrific, with all fresh ingredients, and I choose the chicken and noodles as the variable ingredients. I don't know when I will be back to Cleveland, but when I return, I know I will go back for more. I also had the Rasberry Bliss Bubble Tea, which was very tasty and had these awesome little sugary kiwi sugary juice bubbles. I want to try all the flavors now! Best meal I've had in a very long time! I'm jealous, Cleveland! Thank you, Balance Pan-Asian Grille!

Resonantly priced, I got 3 buns for $4.

The bean paste was my favorite. Ironically enough I liked the bottom of the sweet top butter bun best.

Reason being the top makes a mess with all the crumbs.

Stopped here for a quick, easy lunch after some intense Ikea shopping. I like this take on quick fresh food because I'm a fan of the Asian wok stir fry inside the Market District, which is in the same plaza, and wanted to see if this was similar. It is, but my main suggestion would be to keep the focus on the Asian aspects. They had options to go more Mexican like Chipotle, with black beans and salsas and whatnot. But the overall vibe was Asian, so that was a little confusing Like they're not sure which direction to take. But I guess I get it, they can cover both markets this way. 

I stayed Asian and got a chicken bowl with red rice, eggs, Asian green beans, zucchini, sesame seeds, and teriyaki sauce. The server was not shy on any of the ingredients and I ended up with a whopping bowl. We added chips and salsa and while the chips were a little greasy, they reminded me of the wonton chips at one of my fave Chinese sit down restaurants from my childhood that closed down years ago. BUT I don't feel like the salsa went. Again, it was Mexican style and not Asian. I think a duck sauce type dipping sauce would go waaay better. Left full with over half of my bowl and it heated up great for leftovers. Would stop by again, I think this place will stick around when people catch wind of it! Speedy, fresh, and delicious.

Balance provides swift service in a spare white space. The food ($8.50 per chipotle size bowl) is uniformly fresh and colorful. The curry especially hums and buzzes with heavenly flavor. The menu is vegan-friendly without leaning too heavily on the tired standbys (pro tip: nab yourself a heaping helping of the lentils--they're crispy nibbles of pure joy). There can be a rush for seats at lunchtime (even with that pesky scaffolding erected ten miles high outside the joint, office dwellers sick of the downtown's endless array of pizza and sub shops will find a way in at all costs), but try to sit by the hanging garden on the far wall--Babylon by way of Urban Outfitters.

BYOB (Build Your Own Bowl). I really enjoyed this place the food was very tasty. Lots to choose from. I had a bowl with shrimp and other stuff. Sorry about the poor details but I'm writing this after eating my meal. I'll be back to try more combinations. Service was outstanding. They explained all my options and even let me sample the sauces.

Visited about three weeks ago. Food was great except for the wonton soup was full of pepper.  Had sweet and sour chicken it was delish hardly any breading!!  Service was okay one waitress for the whole store. It was a Saturday night and the place was empty. The food is very similar to a Chinese restaurant in Solon Ohio.

YUM! Traveling for work and was hoping to find a healthy place in the area that delivered. I got the Thai Guy with chicken and Edamame. Both delicious, very clean and quality food. Delicious, definitely worth checking out.
Very impressed with the quality of the food. Owners are always welcoming and have great recommendations. Very glad to see the popularity of this restaurant growing

Was in town for 8 days and had lunch here 3 times. Food was delicious. Lunch special was good and it was a perfect amount of food. Sushi and sashimi were out fast, liked bento box but preferred sushi lunch. Buddy did the hibachi each day rotating through the meats. 
Service was great every time. I have no complaints and next time I'm in town.

TL;DR: Download the app for quick pickup. Convenient and quick option for downtown lunch.
 
I like Balance, I think it serves a really big need in this area which is quick and reliable take out that isn't junky or your standard club sandwich. What I really have to praise Balance for though is their app. Not their appetizers mind you, but the phone application they offer. Normally, I'm the type of person who disdains apps. Just more junk cluttering up my phone, annoying notifications, and difficult to navigate to the point where you just give up and place the order on the phone (or wait, is that just me? Am I getting that antiquated?). In any case, Balance's app is very easy to navigate, only gives notifications to let you know your food is ready, and it's very similar to Chipotle's app interface in terms of the ability to modify orders and repeat previous orders. Also, they offer rewards points though the app, which are very easy to accrue and can be used towards free menu items. 

The food is pretty tasty. The first time I ate here, I got one of the bowls with the whole wheat noodles and I thought they were incredibly delicious. I suspect they coat them with oil and that's why they are so good, but I appreciate that their sauces are all served on the side. The sauces themselves, to be honest, aren't my favorite, most of them are really overly sweet, yet their bang bang sauce I'm told is crazy spicy. I wish they had more variety in the sauces, or at least better explanations of the flavor profiles. One thing I want to mention too is that their bowls are served with the base (rice, noodles, salad greens) and then the steamed veggies on top. I personally love that the veggies are really bright and still crisp, but some might feel that they are borderline raw. The red onions for example are nearly raw, as are the bell peppers. Again, I enjoy this, but it might put off some people that prefer their veggies to be softer and have less of that raw taste. They have a ton of options for bubble teas, most of them are pretty sweet and artificial tasting to me, but I like that you can customize the sweetness when you order, and they also offer both oolong and green tea plain/unsweetened if you prefer. 

Where this place really excels is in their process. When ordering through the app, you can set your pickup time, go straight to the pickup section and there's always a staff member there making sure your order is ready to go and paired with the proper drink. Since you can pay through the app, you can be in and out in just minutes, making it super convenient for those days when you really don't have time to stand around and wait for your lunch. For that reason, I think Balance is a great fit for this area of downtown, and I think I'll end up visiting here quite often.

Good place for lunch.  We ordered the bento boxes and the food was good.  The salad dressing is fair and lacks flavor.  I would not recommend the hot tea.  There is a very off-putting taste from the tea itself or the plastic mugs that they serve it in.

This isn't your American-Chinese place that serves sesame chicken.  Pretty authentic, lots of food for a great price. For two of us, we ordered four dishes and a lot of bakery to go for about $35.  We didn't even finish it.

Very small maybe seats about 15-20 people (probably less depending on your group size). Don't expect spectacular service, but they are friendly! Park on the side street (lakeside) if you can.

I had the fish congee. I added the vinegar and soy sauce for some flavor. I wish they offered a bit more seasonings like green onions and fish sauce.  Make sure if you want potstickers with the combo that you order it. I didn't realize you can also order the congee a la carte and was too full to even bother ordering the potstickers.

The bbq pork was good, very flavorful. Large portion!

I tried the wonton and potsticker soup. There is also cabbage so I wasn't a fan of the cabbage broth.

Okay, what should you get? Definitely the steamed pork rib and black bean sauce crepe. I didn't really care for the steamed pork rib but that sauce was the highlight!!!

The bakery itself is cheap if you're getting things to go. Mostly everything is under $2/piece and they're huge! Not pictured, but the buns are just okay to me. I've had better elsewhere but for what I paid, I'd get them again.
What a refreshing downtown lunch option. Great quality foods and bubble teas! The yumyum sauce is way spicier than usual or else I'd give it 5 stars.

What a refreshing addition to the area! After going through the usual list of restaurants, we decided to try Oryza. I chose the wrap with a noodle base, chicken, Asian guacamole and the Thai sauce. It didn't disappoint. The wrap was full of flavor. Next time I will probably skip the guac though as it was pretty bland when I tried it by itself. 

I decided to try the coconut soup as well, and that however was not something that I couldnt suggest. I am a huge fan of Thai curries and thought this would have a similar taste, it wasn't for me.

We got the o-wedge which is a quesadilla. We decided to go safe with just cheese and onions. It was good, and super cheesy. We added the garlic yum to it as well. These would be perfect for a picky kid or spouse ;) I enjoyed it, but this place has so many things with so many great flavors that I feel like the o-wedge just didn't stand out.

My boyfriend got a bowl with steak, red rice, egg, and onions. He loved it, but mentioned that the cup of sauce was not enough for the whole bowl. He would suggest ordering two.

A friend had mentioned this restaurant concept was like Bilibop, Korean fast food grill in Columbus, Ohio so I thought I would try it. I'm just not a fan I guess of this cuisine Asian style Chipotle. Like other-made-to-order assembly line fast food concepts, I did like the customization and speed of my meal preparation. The cost was reasonable. And for those of you that like it, it adds an option of variety of Asian cuisine options in Settlers Ridge for longtime options of Saga, Thai Foon, and P.F. Chang's.  I'll stick with my Hawaiian poke joints instead. Since I have to give a rating with my review, I chose a 3 star which means for my ratings I won't be back but you might like it.

My favorite place to get sushi, and it's only 2 miles from my house. My mom drives up from Massillon to visit & always suggest we grab a bite here; she loves it! Their sushi is amazing, but the crab Rangoon is literally the best I've ever had. If I get it anywhere else, I'm extremely disappointed now haha. I've never had a bad experience here, but beware that it's a very small place, with not a lot of tables, kinda close together. Other than that, one of my favorite places to go.
I really enjoyed the healthy options and their unique take on bubble tea. Good flavors and I felt great after the meal. I'll be back.

I'm not sure if it's the bowl I made, or that I'm coming off the high of just devouring it -- but this place is primo. The setup is a little strange - like a chipotle for Asian food - you can even make a wrap/ burrito Asian style. BUT the bowl I just ate was killer, the portion was insanely massive, it tasted great, the options are abundant, and the cost was low for what I got. I say, give it a shot.

The food is absolutely delicious here.  I don't know which deserves the highest star rating more- how great the food tastes, or the super friendly staff working here.  I've already been to this place 4 times this week!  The concept is a lot like what you would expect of a Chipotle:  bowl, salad, or wrap, and then a base (white rice, red rice, or noodles), next is the protein (which determines the price), vegetables, and sauces (I LOVE the garlic yum).  

The review before mine is really detailed and I highly recommend reading it!  My only disagreement is that I love the dining area; the long window benches are great seating with big, open windows to see all of the bustle going on outside since it is right next to the movie theatre.  They also have a few tables outside which is great for that area too!   

My only suggestion/change would be for the chips; if they were more of a dessert based item, I think they would be great (serve them in a container, drizzle them with caramel and powdered sugar), but I know being a chain I don't think there's a lot of flexibility with choices there.  Just an idea :)  

I absolutely recommend checking out this location!!!

Pleasantly surprised by this new place up in Settlers. Yes, it's just like Chipotle but with an Asian twist. If you're familiar with the restaurant Bibibop, it's almost the exact same! I hope they can stick around for a long time!

You can choose from wraps, bowls, and salads. From there, you choose a protein, vegetables, sauces, and extras. I'm a little confused about the option of chips and salsa, but I'm not complaining. I will say if you like yum yum sauce from hibachi places, you'll LOVE this place because they serve various types of yum yum sauces to top everything off (the garlic yum tastes most like it). They even have some really tasty fruity looking drink options like blue raspberry lemonade by the pop machines. 

The options are super cheap, and you get a lot of food to fill you up. I paid about $8 for my chicken bowl, and I could've made two meals out of it if I wanted to. I didn't want to though because the yum yum sauce was too good. Great, friendly staff here too. The manager (I believe) came outside to make sure our food was alright, and for a chain, that's respectable to me. 

My only complaint is that some of my toppings, like the egg, were kind of lukewarm, but that's definitely not a huge deal to me. Give this place a shot next time you're in the area.
The wiseman bowl is healthy and passion fruit tea is good but these flavors aren't exactly authentic or Asian. It's his typical teriyaki and some tradiontal milk tea flavors like taro would be nice

Don't be fooled by the small building. This was our first stop on our trip to Madison this past weekend and it did not disappoint! I was a little shocked at how small their case was BUT, they had so many varieties of buns. Our favorite was the BBQ pork bun. Everything we had tasted fresh. My only disappointment is that there wasn't any cake slices  I would've loved to try. 

We'll definitely make this a stop each time we visit Madison.

Stopped in a few weeks ago. From the reviews, I had high hopes for the food. Unfortunately, the sushi is very average (though the prices are reasonable). The rice tasted plain, like there was no vinegar added, and the fish had a strange and bitter taste and smell. Maybe it was just an off service, but the experience I had left me very underwhelmed. Probably will not be returning, as there are much better places for sushi in Cleveland.
Went there for lunch several times over a ten day period. Service was always quick. Food was always good. We got sushi, and hibachi items. Would definitely recommend this place.

Since our first visit a few weeks ago, we've gone three more times.  Have only tried the red rice bowl with spicy chicken but it's so good I don't want to try anything else!  Great food, friendly staff, clean and a good price!  You won't be disappointed. 

Two recommendations.. turn the music down because as fun as it is, it's hard to hold a conversation and second have the staff be more consistent with portions. My last trip a newbie made my bowl and compared to my friend (same ingredients) it was noticeably less.  The other guy took it back and topped it off after I pointed out the difference so again, great staff.

Really liked the set-up and design of this spot. Very clean and trendy, with an ample amount of comfortable seating. 5 stars here. In terms of food, really liked that they offered grass-fed and finished beef -- and found the Teriyaki beef to be a really good choice. Mmmmm. Coming in for the first time, i was really excited for a Chipotle-like Asian offering, since I can't eat at Chipotle everyday -- but also had a real hard time getting into a groove putting my bowl together.  Really thought there could be more Asian ingredients offered, if that's the route you wanted to go OR perhaps more Hispanic-like ingredients to go that route. Then obviously fusion/crossover could always be an option. Overall flavor and freshness was there. Just missed the flavor identity in my bowl. Felt like I had a lot of counteracting flavor and texture, just to get myself to a bowl that would fill me up.

This was the worst place ever! First of all they gave me the wrong order and would not give me my money back when I requested it and they said stayed customers are not always right, she said I was wrong because her employee did not take note of my order correctly, how funny is that! To top it off my roasted pork fried rice had black curly hairs that look like pubic hairs, my orange chicken had a glossy creamy thickness that look like someone ejaculator all over my food like semen! I could not believe my eyes! Please people report this restaurant to the Better Business Bureau, be cautious of ordering here as you don't know if you're eating food or someone's body fluids! I told the owner and she just yelled at me between English and Chinese, I could not understand her. She said "no refund"
Unfortunately I was hungry and I did not eat my food and threw it away and went to Burger King! Please this is not a joke, and is that even a one star restaurant! it is zero! God bless us all with what we order!

I was lucky enough to receive an invite to their special event with Chip tha Ripper. I have been eager for this place to open and to try their food, but was even more ecstatic to see that the proceeds were going toward the Hunger Network of Greater Cleveland. The location is a bit tricky to reach by car. I came on a Saturday at 1pm and had to park a couple blocks away in a 1 hour only metered parking spot. Additionally, at the moment there is a lot of construction going on near the restaurant, so finding the entrance was a challenge. 

We were welcomed warmly when we entered and given a brief overview of how the menu works. I recommend just grabbing the paper copy because it may take a minute to figure everything out if you have never been. I was really intrigued by the tacos, but decided to get a bowl since that is their main attraction. I ordered the teriyaki bowl with chicken breast (added cost, the standard chicken is thigh meat) over greens I also ordered the pickled beets and collards. My friend ordered the wiseman bowl with chicken thighs and rice. The woman taking our order was super friendly and personable, like the rest of the staff, and was kind enough to offer us free cups of water and suggestions while ordering. She also asked if we were dining together, so that our orders would come on the same tray, which was great.

The aesthetic inside is awesome, there is a very clean and modern feel and tons of fresh plants. (There were also iphone chargers at some of the tables, so cool!) 

The food was incredibly fresh and I was so happy to see the sauce comes on the side so you can add to your liking. Honestly the chicken was really special which sounds weird- but normally at fast-casual restaurants such as these, I always feel like the protein tastes like it came out of a microwave. This tasted fresh off the grill. The pickled beets I ended up adding to my bowl and were delightful. I will definitely be back at some point. I would love to try some of the taco options in the future. Unfortunately, I probably won't be able to come in as often as I would due to the location and difficult parking, but this would definitely be a great lunch stop if you work in the area, or find yourself downtown for the day.
Put it this way ~ my husband and I won't eat at any other Chinese restaurant in the city.  Always outstanding and consistent.  The Thai menu is fabulous and the chicken and eggplant is to die for.

Been coming for the last 10 years on Christmas Eve tolerated the service because the food was excellent, it's sad to say that we will have to look for a new tradition  on Christmas Eve and a new Chinese
 restaurant when I am in the North hills.  Split a family of 8 up on Christmas Eve when reservation were made the first week in December. Food was horrible  like we ordered amazing chicken soup with all the sauce on it. Couldn't get a refill on a drink or soy sauce or anything our table need.

Omg what a find! Not gonna lie, was skeptical, but this place is legit! I would come back just for the Tom Yum soup! If you're in the area you gotta try this place! Blew my socks off! Everything was super fresh and made to order! Can't beat that! Nice mom and pop shop.

Good food, good service and clean.  I had the cashew chicken, my wife had the general tsao's chicken and my son had chicken fried rice.  All were very good.  My only complaint, and it is very minor, is that the chairs have wheels.  It is very easy to scoot yourself around unexpectedly.  I will definitely return the next time I am in Madison.
Well priced, really good. My daughter and I love sharing the lo mein. The family meal packages are a great price with a nice selection to feed the whole family. We love this place!

I wish there was a way to give negative stars but, it looks like you can't so I will give you a description of our take out experience. We ordered a dinner meal and a sushi app. The app wasn't great. We ordered a spicy salmon roll, not a tuna roll which is what we received.  That wasn't even the worst part. My wife ordered the Mongolian beef which she was underwhelmed with.  The worst part of the experience was that I got violently ill instantly after just a few bites of the general tso chicken.  I was not upset but we wanted to call and notify they restaurant in case others had similar issues. No, instead we were told to go to the hospital and get checked out and if it was food poisoning then they have insurance to cover. No sorry. No apologies. Just talk to our insurance company. So this must not be in an isolated incident since they have a canned response to tell customers.  Thank you for the last meal I will ever have at sesame inn. Enjoy your food poisoning insurance claims.

Contrary to my checkins, I eat here all the time, mainly for lunch and sometimes dinner.  Almost always carry out (only because I live so close).  The ambiance here is a bit dated, but clean, fung shui deco'd and good for all sorts of occasions.  The take out is very good, but dining in is always better.  I'm a big shrimp fan and I love their General Tso's Shrimp, shrimp lo mein and shrimp fried rice.  They're my go-to dishes and they do them very well.

Fast order online ! Fast delivery as well ! Hot and ready to eat ! I can't say enough about how pleased I was to get this order with no issues what so ever and a very friendly delivery person also ! 
I asked for the white sauce and revived it. Very tasty 
Hot white rice and chicken fried rice ! 
Shrimp egg roll and spring rolls !!! 
Highly recommend!! 
Will defiantly order again

Sesame Inn has truly been my guilty pleasure after my workouts at Club Julian. We all need a treat some time. Anyways, the decor is beautiful, in my humble opinion. There is a sushi bar area and regular seating. I love good service, and I feel they were very kind and cool; the atmosphere is calm and inviting. 
Ok, so I have actually been there on several different occasions, to dine in and for take out. The Amazing Chicken is good. Fresh white meat chicken, cooked to perfection...not too dry. But my addiction is the chicken lo mein and chicken egg roll. It is so delicious. I have a hard time eating other restaurants lo mein now after this. So, it is a must try!!!!
 And again, I love the chicken eggrolls. The shrimp eggrolls are good as well but it is a spring roll with a lighter crust. But still tasty!
This is a good date night place, girls night out, or in my case...cheat night after the gym.
I've found it, chinese food that matches my favorite from home in everyway. Today is a happy, joy, joy day !

No fortune in the fortune cookie! Are you for real?!

So my friend and I are scoping out all the Chinese restaurants in Madison, and this one was not impressive. Although it looked promising when we arrived because of how many people were here, we quickly learned the truth. This place ... is whack. I ordered my go to - cashew chicken - and my friend ordered one of her go to's - fried rice with beef - and we were both NOT impressed. Second bite into my chicken, and it's HARD. Like BONE hard. Eew. And my friend's fried rice had so much egg in it, it took up a quarter of her plate after picking the egg out of a third of her dish. Like, we know protein is important, but there are other food groups too, ya know? The best parts of my cashew chicken were the cashews and the white rice - which if you don't know - are impossible to mess up. So we wait for our bill, like forever, and when we finally get it, there are our fortune cookies! I open mine, and it has the fortune sticking out, and she opens hers, and BOOM. No fortune. That's like the whole reason we're doing this. We love those fortunes. Disappointment. Wah. Anyway. The chicken was bad quality, I've had much better. The pieces that weren't hard were dark meat - very spongy. But they fill up that soy sauce bottle real good, because we used over half of it, so that's a plus. Prices weren't bad either. Overall, we decided not to come back.

Don't even know hot to start,me and my wife used to order from this place many times,as usual I got Mei fun with vegetables and my wife duck with vegetables all was take out,when I got home with order there was no duck in duck with vegetables dish,only chicken beef and duck skin on top to cover it,which is just ridiculous we came back to the restaurant and explained everything to cashier which seemed to understand but then this crazy woman came from the back and start yelling at us that we took this food home ate all the duck and brought the skin back,this is just so crazy I would not recommend anyone to go only if you want to fight over some stupid shit with old crazy lady,I will never go there again and tell my friend and everyone I know to do the same.

I really don't know what happened with all of the negative reviewers. We've been coming to Imperial Garden since 1997.  We've tried other places, but this place is easily the best  for Chinese food anywhere in the area. Chicken & Broccoli, Beef Lo-mein, Stir fried rice noodles, steamed pot stickers, & the chicken egg foo young are all great! General Tso's is good too.  Staff is very friendly, many have been working there for 10+ years, and we are remembered when we come in- a nice touch. We've been to the westside location as well. Good, but not as good as East, if you ask me. If you don't believe me, take a look at the wall in the lobby. They've won best in Madison nearly every year since 1987! How many restaurants around now can say the same thing??

Been here a few times now, usually when I'm headed to the mall or to Gabes. 

The lunch menu is reasonably priced and the portions are very generous! Some of the things that we have sampled include the egg rolls, coconut shrimp, pork dumplings, amazing chicken, and Singapore noodles. 

Everything is well made and comes out of the kitchen quickly. Service is always great and the tea is also delicious! 

Can't wait to go back!

I dont know how places like this stay in business???? It was awful!!!! I mean how can you mess up brocolli? It was like they opened up a jar of brown gravy and poured it over top. Gross!!! I will not be back.

One star doesn't do this place justice. They deserve less.

We ordered a delivery of food for dinner. Upon opening the fried rice that we ordered we discovered that a bug had gotten into the food. It appeared to have been fried along with the rice. Needless to say we were displeased. We called them back and asked them to come pick up the food as we weren't going to eat it, and to bring back a reciept for the credit card cancellation of the order.

Half an hour later a man with a flashlight showed up at our door. We gave him the food back, as we'd packed it back in the bag. He proceeded to unpack the food on our patio and start digging through the fried rice with the flashlight to look for the bug. Then he started going through the rest of the food - on our patio. Making a mess with BBQ rib sauce... when asked to leave he started arguing with us. We had to threaten to call the police before he would leave the porch.

When we called and asked to speak to the manager, we were told that the man with the flashlight who had been on our porch WAS the manager.

Needless to say, I am never ordering from there again. Completely inappropriate behavior from them.  Zero stars if I could give it.
Super nice environment for Chinese food! Also do some Thai. Mostly Americanized dishes due to demographics of the community. A bit pricey, but the portion is big!

This inside second time here now. I love the way it looks inside, and the food is always great! Shout out to Clayton! He was our server both times and we really like him and plan to request him when we come back, and yes, we WILL be back. I love the white tuna, and miso soup. The Szechwan shrimp with fried rice was great too, as well as the shumai.

I never knew about this place until my daughter told me I HAD to try it. I had the broccoli chicken with white rice. The crab rangoon and sauce was the best I've ever had, and everything is made in house, and very fresh. I tried my boyfriends Tom yum soup, and it was delicious! They ask you what spice level you want from 1-10. I chose 7, and it was pretty spicy! But oh so delicious. Next time I will order a 5. The owners are super nice and friendly, and don't just treat you like a number. If you want the real deal, you should try this place! Bonus if you like it HOT! I can't wait to go back.

This one is not the one at Ross park mall, although they have the same name. This one only has American Chinese food. Don't expect more. But really cheap. We ordered four entrees and four soup, that's only about $25 plus tips.

Takeout service lacking. First concern seems to be on processing the volume of takeout - just hope you don't get lost in the shuffle. Our order was more than 30 minutes late. Of course when we got home most of our dishes were luke warm or cooler - we did not order any sushi. Strongly suggest avoiding for takeout.

Absolutely delicious food. The tom yum soup is without a doubt the best we've had in a 50 mile radius. We also had the garlic shrimp and sesame chicken, which were both wonderful. Everything is obviously made from fresh ingredients; even the fried food tasted fresh and clean. The decor is simple but stylish and the entire restaurant is spotlessly clean. The staff is friendly and the prices are more than reasonable. Even if it's a bit of a drive, it is well worth the travel time. Definitely give it a try.

This is the last time I will order from here...ever!

Tonight my husband and I ordered dinner from here.  We proceeded to begin eating at which time I found a crispy fried fly in my rice.

We called the restaurant and asked them to come and get the uneaten food and to refund our money because we were not going to be eating it.

At this point a man came with a flashlight and began going through the food on our porch, would not leave, and did not give us our refund.  He did not leave until I threatened to call the police.

we called the restaurant again at which point they informed us that he was the manager.

Never Again
Always stellar. Food is fabulous and fast. Drinks are always unique and delicious. Have been coming here for years. Highly recommended!

Went for dinner.  Ordered Amazing Chicken and Moo Shi Beef.  Food arrived after a considerable wait.  Both entrees were cold.  When we brought this to the attention of the waitress, she said the cook put it in take out containers.When she finally found the food, she dumped it on a plate and served us. She said she would microwave it to heat it up.  If we wanted microwaved food, we would not have come to a restaurant.  Very disappointed in their food, service and management.  Better off eating at this place for lunch, never again for dinner!

This place blows the doors off of any restaurants  of its kind around. The food is amazing. One of my favorite things about BBR THEY KNOW HOW TO MAKE IT HOT!!! 
When I say that, they do not sacrifice flavor to make it hot. I truly love this place and the people that own it.

They served my $40 Peking Duck with Mexican tortilla's. They even had the plastic tortilla holder that says "tortilla's" on the lid. What an absolute fraud. Duck meat was dry, sauce was just soy reduction. 

I hear they have great General Tso's though!

My first review and it's bad. God, I didn't think it was possible to mess Chinese food up but I was in fact wrong. I ordered off Grubhub & they were an hour late. I get the bag and my buffalo sauce is dripping on my egg roll and near my general tsos. Also, the wonton soup is starting to leak as well. I ignore it and decide to dig in. The wonton soup was meh - noodles were skimpy. The egg roll was ok but I felt like they used shrimps you buy at Walmart. The wings were ok if you wanna ignore they weren't spicy at all & the meat was dark. 

I now open my general tsos hoping it's good. WRONG. There were 7 pieces of chicken floating in sauce but the sauce had absolutely no taste to it. It wasn't hot or spicy - just bland. The fried rice was the only redeeming part of the meal. I have never thrown away General tsos but today, I did.

Never ordering from here again. 0/5.

We really enjoyed our meal there.  We ordered a variety of dishes including curry beef,  egg foo young and Governor's chicken.  Nothing trendy,  just reliable Chinese dishes.  Everything was fresh,  and the beef egg foo young was especially good.  We'd return.
It was not bad but the wonton soup was bland and the chicken and broccoli had almost not flavor. Tasted like the chicken was boiled.  The beef and pea pods were good.  Reasonable dinner size plate

Great atmosphere. Busy trade, which is a good sign. We had the almond chicken which was excellent. We also had the general Tsos which has spoiled me for all other general tsos. The chicken was so delicious and crisp on the outside, yet moist and tasty on the inside! Worth the drive if you are not nearby.

Stopped in there today had the Amazing Chicken which is general tso's with real white meat chicken.  It was delicious and some of the best Chinese food I've ever had and will def go back.  It was $9 for the lunch portion with choice of rice and either soup or egg roll.  Well worth the price and the portion was a good size.

Probably one of the best Chinese places I've found in Pittsburgh. Most Chinese places are all the same and it all tastes average. Sesame Inn is a lot nicer than your typical neighborhood Chinese restaurant. 

I started with a bowl of hot and sour soup which was very good. Some places make theirs too sweet and others make it too hot. This was the perfect balance of both. As my entree I got the sesame chicken which I wasn't all that impressed with but that is only because I'm not a huge fan of dark meat. I did however try my friends amazing chicken and the name is very fitting. The amazing chicken had just the right amount of breaking. It was not loaded with fried breaking like a lot of other Chinese places. It was also made with white meat which I like a lot better. The only complaint I would have is the price. It is about double the price of your local Chinese restaurant so be prepared to spend $15-20 on a entree. 

Ambiance: 4
Food/Drink quality: 4
Presentation: 3
Price: 3
Overall: 4

I absolutely LOVE this place.  My son recommended it last time we visited.  I didn't expect much, but everything was fantastic from the drinks to the Chinese to the sushi.  When we headed to Pittsburgh again last weekend I had to get back there even though I was beyond exhausted from the 11 hour drive.  There was a 30 min wait, which we weren't in the mood for, so we sat at the bar.  The bartender was super friendly and our food was out in a flash.  Best part - it was just as great as the last time we had it.

Even though we love the usual suspects when visiting Pitt - this is my #1 must go to.

Note:  the two times we went were at two different locations.  The one at the mall was situated really weird.  You feel like you're driving into a car dealer.  I prefer the atmosphere of the one near GreenTree - sorry, I can't remember the name of the town - but they're both great.

This place is mediocre at best.  My husband and I ordered for carry out.  We ordered the crab rangoons as an appetizer, however, I think they forgot to add the crab to the filling.  The were stuffed with chunks of cream cheese--very boring and lacking in flavor.  My husband ordered the General Tso's Chicken and I ordered Cashew Shrimp, neither of which were remarkable.  We are going to keep trying to find a decent Chinese restaurant in the Madison area, that's for sure.

This mainstay has been at the corner of Saxonburg and Rte 8 since at least 2002; it's a pretty good place to get your Chinese buffet fill, and it's also supercheap ($~6 for lunch buffet) - with that said the food is your typical Chinese fare in Pittsburgh, but it's also the only Chinese restaurant for miles around.
The food is fresh and good. we have ordered hot and sour chicken and sesame chicken. Looks like both of them are cooked fresh. The soup is mediocre. The service is really good.

Try the shrimp egg foo young.  It is the best ever.  The shrimp fried rice is great, good with vegetables.
